analyzed: sus phyin ci log gang gis sgrub par byed do //
translated: By what and by whom is it accomplished?

original: sangs rgyas byang chub thob par byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la 'jog par mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes pa rtags so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub thob par byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la 'jog par mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes pa rtags so //
translated: Because it is the very agent of attaining the enlightenment of the buddhas. The explanation of this is: because it causes the placement in the realm of nonabiding nirvana.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rab tu ston pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rab tu ston pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the enlightenment of the buddhas and so on.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi le'u bshad pa de ston par byed pa ni rab tu snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi le'u bshad pa de ston par byed pa ni rab tu snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: The one who teaches that explanation of the chapter on the thought of enlightenment is the one who illuminates it.

original: le'u zhes pa ni sngar bshad do //
analyzed: le'u zhes pa ni sngar bshad do //
translated: The chapter is as previously explained.

original: rnal 'byor pa gnyis kyis zhes pa ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gnyis kyis zhes pa ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbye ba'o //
translated: The two yogis are distinguished by the generation and completion yogas.

original: rnam pa gsum zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: The three aspects are the meaning to be explained.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni drug pa'o //
translated: The great Vajradhara is the sixth.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams ni lnga'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams ni lnga'o //
translated: Akshobhya and the others are the five.

original: de rnams ni drug po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni drug po rnams kyi'o //
translated: Those are the six.

original: de'i phyir yang na lnga po de rnams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang na lnga po de rnams so //
translated: Therefore, they are the five.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Therefore, it is by way of explanation.

original: lha zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i lha drug go //
analyzed: lha zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i lha drug go //
translated: The deity is the six deities such as the great Vajradhara.

original: sngags zhes pa ni ma tri gsang ba'i skad la'o //
analyzed: sngags zhes pa ni ma tri gsang ba'i skad la'o //
translated: The mantra is the secret language of Matrika.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: lce rtse g-yo ba yod min zhing //🔽so @68a * //
analyzed: lce rtse g-yo ba yod min zhing // so @68a * //
translated: The tip of the tongue does not move.🔽The teeth

original: dang mchu gnyis yang dag sbyar //
analyzed: dang mchu gnyis yang dag sbyar //
translated: and the two lips are properly joined.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa sngags kyi bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa sngags kyi bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes so //
translated: The characteristics of mantra recitation are like that.

original: sngags ni yid skyob par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: sngags ni yid skyob par byed pa'i don to //
translated: The mantra is for the purpose of protecting the mind.

original: ngan 'gro'i 'gro ba 'jigs pa rnams kyi skyob par gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i 'gro ba 'jigs pa rnams kyi skyob par gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the very protector of those who are afraid of the destinies of the miserable realms, and because it is the very nature of the six transcendent lords.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gsang sngags zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gsang sngags zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mantra that will be explained is as follows:

original: gsungs pa yang /🔽gang gang dbang po yul rnams kyis //
analyzed: gsungs pa yang / gang gang dbang po yul rnams kyis //
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: brten nas bskyed par bya ba'i yid //
analyzed: brten nas bskyed par bya ba'i yid //
translated: The mind that is generated in dependence on the objects of the senses

original: yid de man na zhes par bshad //
analyzed: yid de man na zhes par bshad //
translated: is explained as the mind that is below.

original: tra yig skyob par byed pa'i don //
analyzed: tra yig skyob par byed pa'i don //
translated: The syllable tra has the meaning of protection.🔽And:

original: zhes pa dang / sngags ni 'bod pa zhes bshad de //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / sngags ni 'bod pa zhes bshad de //
translated: A mantra is explained as a call,

original: de nyid bskul bar smra ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bskul bar smra ba'o //
translated: and that itself is an invocation.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyang sngags su 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyang sngags su 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, reality will be explained as a mantra.

original: rdo rje dang padma 'du byas pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma 'du byas pa ni /
translated: The union of the vajra and lotus

original: chos 'byung ste chos phung la sogs pa rnams 'dir 'byung ngo zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: chos 'byung ste chos phung la sogs pa rnams 'dir 'byung ngo zhes byas nas so //
translated: is the source of phenomena, because the aggregates of phenomena and so forth arise from it.

original: de dag 'dir 'gag pa dang skye'o zhes de la gnas pa'i rten dang brten pa'i bdag nyid can gyi lha'i 'khor lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'dir 'gag pa dang skye'o zhes de la gnas pa'i rten dang brten pa'i bdag nyid can gyi lha'i 'khor lor 'gyur ro //
translated: They are said to cease and arise here, and so the divine wheel, which has the nature of a support and the supported, is formed.

original: de la lha'i 'khor lo'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /🔽rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa sta /
analyzed: de la lha'i 'khor lo'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa / rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa sta /
translated: With regard to that, the divine wheel is taught, beginning with Vairochana.

original: de dang de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs ba'i rigs de dang de'i rang gi bdag po zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de dang de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs ba'i rigs de dang de'i rang gi bdag po zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase in that and that and so forth refers to the family of Vairochana and so forth. Their own lord means

original: gang gi bdag po gang yin pa ni rang gi bdag po'o //
analyzed: gang gi bdag po gang yin pa ni rang gi bdag po'o //
translated: that which is the lord of that is its own lord.

original: kha dog lnga ba'i sa'i cha dang ldan pa ni lnga'i bdag nyid kyi lha'i 'khor lo 'di nyid kyi kha dog gis sa'i cha kha dog lnga nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog lnga ba'i sa'i cha dang ldan pa ni lnga'i bdag nyid kyi lha'i 'khor lo 'di nyid kyi kha dog gis sa'i cha kha dog lnga nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase endowed with the five-colored earth part means that this divine wheel, which has the nature of five, is the five colors of the earth part, because of its own color.

original: kha dog lnga'i sa'i cha zhes pa'i gsung las lha mo'i bha gar khang pa brtsegs pa yang bsgom par bya'o zhes mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog lnga'i sa'i cha zhes pa'i gsung las lha mo'i bha gar khang pa brtsegs pa yang bsgom par bya'o zhes mtshon par bya'o //
translated: The phrase five-colored earth part should be understood to indicate that the celestial mansion should be visualized in the bhaga of the goddess.

original: phyi rol du yang ye shes kyi gzhi khang pa brtsegs pa bsgom pa rjod par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /🔽sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: phyi rol du yang ye shes kyi gzhi khang pa brtsegs pa bsgom pa rjod par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na / sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: But is it not taught that the basis of pristine awareness is also meditated on as an external mansion?🔽The later Guhyasamaja Tantra teaches:🔽Meditate on the three corners

original: zur gsum rnams su rnam bsgom bya //🔽zhes 'dus pa phyi mar gsungs pa /
analyzed: zur gsum rnams su rnam bsgom bya // zhes 'dus pa phyi mar gsungs pa /
translated: by the divisions of body, speech, and mind.

original: gsang ba'i nang la ltos pa la //
analyzed: gsang ba'i nang la ltos pa la //
translated: This is taught in terms of the inner secret,

original: rmongs nas phyi rol du yang rjod par byed de 'jig rten dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: rmongs nas phyi rol du yang rjod par byed de 'jig rten dang 'gal lo //
translated: but out of confusion it is also taught as external, contradicting the world.

original: gang 'jig rten na phyir rol gyi khyim dang khang bzangs la sogs pa rnams byed pa gsang ba'i nang gi gnas la ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten na phyir rol gyi khyim dang khang bzangs la sogs pa rnams byed pa gsang ba'i nang gi gnas la ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: In the world, external houses, mansions, and so on are not made in dependence on internal secret places.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i rim par yang khang pa brtsegs pa'i ri dang gzhal med khang la @68b sogs pa'i rnam par gnas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i rim par yang khang pa brtsegs pa'i ri dang gzhal med khang la @68b sogs pa'i rnam par gnas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, in the system of the Vajravidarana Tantra, it is taught that the mansion is situated in the form of a mountain and a celestial mansion and so on.

original: lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ste gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga ste gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five, etc. , are the five sense objects of form, sound, etc. , because they have the nature of Vajra Form, etc.

original: gsungs pa gzugs zhes pa la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa gzugs zhes pa la sogs ba'o //
translated: The statement beginning with “form” is the reply.

original: mchod pa rnam pa lnga zhes pa ni lnga por rnams kyi nye bar sdud par bya nye bar 'dul bar byed do zhes pa lnga yang de yin la mchod pa yang de yin pas te gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lnga zhes pa ni lnga por rnams kyi nye bar sdud par bya nye bar 'dul bar byed do zhes pa lnga yang de yin la mchod pa yang de yin pas te gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The five kinds of worship are the five kinds of sense objects, because they are the five and they are worship, since they are the objects of worship.

original: mdor na zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mdor na zhes pa ni /
translated: In brief, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor du sgeg mo la sogs pa'i lha mo dang bla re la sogs pas rgya cher mngon par brjod par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du sgeg mo la sogs pa'i lha mo dang bla re la sogs pas rgya cher mngon par brjod par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: , because it is the desire to express the extensive by means of the goddesses such as Charm, the canopy, etc.

original: lha'i 'khor lo zhes pa ni lha rnams kyi 'khor lo bzhin du gnas pa'i khyad par ram lha rnams kyi 'ang 'khor lo khang pa brtsegs pa ste lha'i 'khor lor bsams nas so //
analyzed: lha'i 'khor lo zhes pa ni lha rnams kyi 'khor lo bzhin du gnas pa'i khyad par ram lha rnams kyi 'ang 'khor lo khang pa brtsegs pa ste lha'i 'khor lor bsams nas so //
translated: The wheel of gods is the special abode of the gods, like a wheel, or the mansion of the wheel of the gods.

original: 'khor lo'i dbus su ni /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dbus su ni /
translated: In the center of the wheel,

original: rten dang brten pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su gsang ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i bdag por gyur pa nyid kyis ni mi bskyod pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su gsang ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i bdag por gyur pa nyid kyis ni mi bskyod pa nyid kyis so //
translated: in the center of the wheel of the support and the supported, by the nature of the lord of the secret mansion, by the nature of Akshobhya.

original: phyir rol gyi khang pa brtsegs pa'i dbus su ni bdag po rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid kyis so //
analyzed: phyir rol gyi khang pa brtsegs pa'i dbus su ni bdag po rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid kyis so //
translated: In the center of the outer mansion, by the nature of the lord, Great Vajradhara.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs bzhin du zhes dang / slar yang gsungs pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sprul par gyur pa zhes dang / slar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs bzhin du zhes dang / slar yang gsungs pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sprul par gyur pa zhes dang / slar yang gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said, “like the form of Great Vajradhara,” and again it is said, “the emanation of Great Vajradhara,” and again it is said,

original: sdud par byed ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdud par byed ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “the compiler,” and so on.

original: de dang zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po dang ngo //
translated: “That” refers to Great Vajradhara.

original: mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya chen po ni gsang ba'i 'khor lo las phyi rol du byas pa'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya chen po ni gsang ba'i 'khor lo las phyi rol du byas pa'o //
translated: The great seal of Akshobhya is made external to the secret wheel.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dkon mchog dpal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dkon mchog dpal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, “Ratna Shri” and so on refers to Ratna Shri and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgra las don yod grub pa la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen por bsdus so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra las don yod grub pa la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen por bsdus so //
translated: and so on refers to Amoghasiddhi and so on, included in the great seal.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa drug mngon par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa drug mngon par brjod pa ni /
translated: Similarly, the six thus-gone ones are

original: bdag po nyid kyis gsang ba'i 'khor lo'i nang dang phyi rol du bsgom par bya pa dag go //
analyzed: bdag po nyid kyis gsang ba'i 'khor lo'i nang dang phyi rol du bsgom par bya pa dag go //
translated: to be meditated on by the lord himself, inside and outside the secret wheel.

original: gang yang gzhan du byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams rdo rje 'chang chen po dang / gcig tu sbyor bas bdag po nyid du 'dod de de yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs su bsdus pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa lnga nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang gzhan du byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams rdo rje 'chang chen po dang / gcig tu sbyor bas bdag po nyid du 'dod de de yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs su bsdus pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa lnga nyid do //
translated: And also elsewhere, the bodhisattvas and so on are asserted to be the lord in union with Great Vajradhara, and that is also the five thus-gone ones because they are included in the family of the five thus-gone ones.

original: sogs kyi sgras don gyi bshad pa la rang dbang ma yin @69a * //
analyzed: sogs kyi sgras don gyi bshad pa la rang dbang ma yin @69a * //
translated: The words and so on refer to the explanation of the meaning of the words.

original: pa'i bdag nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: pa'i bdag nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The nature of the non-independent is stated:

original: gang yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: whatever is said and so on.

original: kho bo ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: kho bo ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: I am Akṣobhya.

original: 'dod chags chen po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: Great passion is Great Vajradhara.

original: de'i zhes pa sngar brjod pa yi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa sngar brjod pa yi'o //
translated: His is the one mentioned previously.

original: phyag gi gtso bos 'khor lo bsnams pa zhes pa ni phyag gzhan na gnas pa'i mtshan ma sgrub pa'i thabs su gsungs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: phyag gi gtso bos 'khor lo bsnams pa zhes pa ni phyag gzhan na gnas pa'i mtshan ma sgrub pa'i thabs su gsungs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase “the principal hand holds a wheel” is a statement that the other hands hold the emblems taught in the sādhana.

original: 'dzam bu na dang zhes pa la sogs pas rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa rnams kyi phyag gis gtso bo'i mtshan ma ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dzam bu na dang zhes pa la sogs pas rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa rnams kyi phyag gis gtso bo'i mtshan ma ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase “with a jambūnada” and so on indicates the emblems held by Ratnasaṃbhava and so on.

original: de bzhin du drug pa yi yang phyag gi gtso bo'i g-yas na de bskyed pa'i rgyud dkar po ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du drug pa yi yang phyag gi gtso bo'i g-yas na de bskyed pa'i rgyud dkar po ste /
translated: Similarly, the principal hand of the sixth holds a white wheel, which is the cause of its generation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po bskyed pa'i mtshan ma lnga po bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po bskyed pa'i mtshan ma lnga po bzhin no //
translated: It is like the five emblems that generate the five tathāgatas.

original: 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa rnams so //
translated: “These” refers to the statements of the tathāgatas.

original: dang po'i sbyor ba ni sa bon dang mtshan ma la ltos pas so //
analyzed: dang po'i sbyor ba ni sa bon dang mtshan ma la ltos pas so //
translated: The first application is in relation to the seed and the emblem.

original: dril bu ni thams cad du phyag g-yon nyid na'o //
analyzed: dril bu ni thams cad du phyag g-yon nyid na'o //
translated: The bell is in the left hand in all cases.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes pa ni sems tsam nyid kyis 'gro ba 'dzin par byed do zhes pas chos kyi dbyings te rnam par rig pa tsam nyid do //🔽de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes pa ni sems tsam nyid kyis 'gro ba 'dzin par byed do zhes pas chos kyi dbyings te rnam par rig pa tsam nyid do // de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, the dharmadhātu is mind-only, i.e., vijñapti-mātra.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: drang ba'i don to //
translated: This is the interpretable meaning explanation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag tu med pa la sogs pa lnga ni 'od zer lnga ste dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag tu med pa la sogs pa lnga ni 'od zer lnga ste dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The five, beginning with Amitābha, are the five light-rays, i.e., the nature of the five light-rays, red, etc.

original: steng gi sgo nas ni sna'i bu gnas so //
analyzed: steng gi sgo nas ni sna'i bu gnas so //
translated: From the upper door, i.e., from the nose-hole.

original: byung ste ni rang gi dang nyid do //
analyzed: byung ste ni rang gi dang nyid do //
translated: Having come out, i.e., from one’s own nature.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin gyi khyab byed kyi rlung ni steng nas 'byung ba ma yin nam zhen /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin gyi khyab byed kyi rlung ni steng nas 'byung ba ma yin nam zhen /
translated: Is the pervading wind, the nature of Vairocana, not produced from above?

original: de lta mod kyi 'od zer re re 'byung ba na 'od zer lnga lnga nges par 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'od zer re re 'byung ba na 'od zer lnga lnga nges par 'byung bar byed do //
translated: Even so, when each light-ray is produced, it causes the production of five light-rays.

original: khams kyi dkyil 'khor gcig gis kyang khams bzhi char la khyab bo zhes spyod bsdus su gsungs so //
analyzed: khams kyi dkyil 'khor gcig gis kyang khams bzhi char la khyab bo zhes spyod bsdus su gsungs so //
translated: The Compendium of Practice says that one mandala of elements pervades all four elements.

original: gang du gcig yod pa de la bzhi po zhes pa'i rigs pa las so zhes pas mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: gang du gcig yod pa de la bzhi po zhes pa'i rigs pa las so zhes pas mi 'gal lo //
translated: It is not contradictory because of the reasoning that where one exists, all four exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: sprin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sprin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Clouds and so forth.

original: dkar po la sogs pa zhes pa ni ste /
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa zhes pa ni ste /
translated: White and so forth means

original: sogs kyi sgras dmar po dang ser po dang nag po rnams bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sogs kyi sgras dmar po dang ser po dang nag po rnams bsdus pa'o //
translated: white, red, yellow, and black.

original: a'a li k'a li rnams ni yi ge gcig gis dman pa'i lnga bcu po 'di rnams so //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li rnams ni yi ge gcig gis dman pa'i lnga bcu po 'di rnams so //
translated: The vowels and consonants are the fifty minus one letter.

original: ma ning la sogs pa zhes pa'i sogs kyi sgra las bud med dang skyes pa rnams bsdus so //
analyzed: ma ning la sogs pa zhes pa'i sogs kyi sgra las bud med dang skyes pa rnams bsdus so //
translated: The neuter and so forth means the female and male are included by the word and so forth.🔽It says in the Sandhivyakarana:

original: de la // thung du'i dbyangs ni nyin mor brjod //
analyzed: de la // thung du'i dbyangs ni nyin mor brjod //
translated: The short vowels are said to be the day;

original: ring po zhes pa mtshan mor @69b bshad //
analyzed: ring po zhes pa mtshan mor @69b bshad //
translated: the long ones are said to be the night.

original: dbyangs dang gsal byed dbye ba yis //
analyzed: dbyangs dang gsal byed dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of vowels and consonants,

original: ming gi de nyid sbyar bar bya //🔽zhes dgongs pa lung ston du bshad do //
analyzed: ming gi de nyid sbyar bar bya //🔽zhes dgongs pa lung ston du bshad do //
translated: the reality of the name is applied.

original: nga nya na na ma rnams la ni zhes pa ma ning gi yi ge'o //
analyzed: nga nya na na ma rnams la ni zhes pa ma ning gi yi ge'o //
translated: The neuter syllable is “na” in “nāmas”.

original: mnyam par gzhag cing ni yid la bkod nas so //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag cing ni yid la bkod nas so //
translated: “Concentrated” means placed in the mind.

original: de zhes pa yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: de zhes pa yi ge gsum mo //
translated: “That” is the three syllables.

original: aom zhes dang po gcig ces pa la sogs pas rnams par snang mdzad la sogs pa la 'od zer lnga'i rang bzhin dang drug pa dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: aom zhes dang po gcig ces pa la sogs pas rnams par snang mdzad la sogs pa la 'od zer lnga'i rang bzhin dang drug pa dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid du gsungs so //
translated: “Om” and “the first one” and so forth explain Vairochana and so forth as the nature of the five light rays and the sixth, the lord of the maṇḍala, as the nature of the three syllables.

original: drug po 'di rnams rlung gi de nyid dang sngags kyi de nyid kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje gsum du bsdus par bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa /🔽aom shar  du n+ya t'a zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: drug po 'di rnams rlung gi de nyid dang sngags kyi de nyid kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje gsum du bsdus par bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa / aom shar  du n+ya t'a zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Desiring to teach that these six are included in the three vajras, which are the nature of the reality of the winds and the reality of the mantras, he says:🔽“Om, the wind, the fire, and the earth, the water, and the space, and the mind, the sixth, are the three vajras.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, he says:

original: de nyid gsum du 'dir brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsum du 'dir brtags pa'o //
translated: “The three realities are imagined here.”

original: de la rlung gi de nyid ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba gsum mo //
analyzed: de la rlung gi de nyid ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba gsum mo //
translated: There, the reality of the winds is the three: entering, abiding, and rising.

original: sngags kyi de nyid ni yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: sngags kyi de nyid ni yi ge gsum mo //
translated: The reality of the mantras is the three syllables.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i 'bras bu de nyid gsum po snang ba gsum dang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi 'ang de nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i 'bras bu de nyid gsum po snang ba gsum dang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi 'ang de nyid do //
translated: The result of vajra repetition is the reality of the three appearances and of the eye consciousness, etc.

original: de la ji ltar bskyed pa'i rim pas sngags kyi de nyid kyis dang po'i mgon po bskyed pa la yi ge gsum gcig tu gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la ji ltar bskyed pa'i rim pas sngags kyi de nyid kyis dang po'i mgon po bskyed pa la yi ge gsum gcig tu gyur pa nyid do //
translated: In that regard, by the reality of mantra as it is generated by the stage of generation, the Primordial Protector is generated, and the three syllables become one.

original: spyod bsdus su yang lus rnam par spen pa'i mthar thug par rdo rje gsum po rnams rang bzhin gyis grub pa nga'o zhes gcig nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: spyod bsdus su yang lus rnam par spen pa'i mthar thug par rdo rje gsum po rnams rang bzhin gyis grub pa nga'o zhes gcig nyid du bstan to //
translated: In the Compendium of Practice, at the end of the section on the body emanation, the three vajras are taught to be one, with the statement “I am the naturally existing one.”

original: de bzhin du rdo rje bzlas pa'i 'bras bu snang ba gsum nyid kyi bdag nyid can ye shes kyi sku bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje bzlas pa'i 'bras bu snang ba gsum nyid kyi bdag nyid can ye shes kyi sku bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the result of vajra repetition is the generation of the body of wisdom, which is the nature of the three appearances.

original: gsal ba ni ma bcos pa nyid kyis nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ni ma bcos pa nyid kyis nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is clear because it is perceived by being unfabricated.

original: mi gsal ba ni sha dang khrag dang rus pa'i khams la sogs pa rnams kyis kun du mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni sha dang khrag dang rus pa'i khams la sogs pa rnams kyis kun du mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is not clear because it is not disturbed by the elements of flesh, blood, and bone.

original: / gsungs pa yang ji ltar chu'i nang du byung ba'i skyes bu'i rnam par snang ba de ni khams rnams kyis rnam par 'khrugs pa med do //
analyzed: / gsungs pa yang ji ltar chu'i nang du byung ba'i skyes bu'i rnam par snang ba de ni khams rnams kyis rnam par 'khrugs pa med do //
translated: “Just as the appearance of a person in water is not disturbed by the elements,

original: 'di la bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa kun du dmigs par 'gyur ba yang med do zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa kun du dmigs par 'gyur ba yang med do zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and there is no apprehension of the conceptualization of pleasure, pain, and so on, in this case.”

original: da ni gsungs pa'i don 'di nyid bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni gsungs pa'i don 'di nyid bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa /
translated: Now, wishing to teach just this meaning that was stated, he says:

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Space, etc.”

original: nam mkha'i dbyings ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The realm of space is suchness.

original: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽yang dag par sbyor ba gsum gyi sku ni sku la sogs pa gsum po rnams kyi @70a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro // yang dag par sbyor ba gsum gyi sku ni sku la sogs pa gsum po rnams kyi @70a * //
translated: The maṇḍala of the buddhas is the nature of all tathāgatas.🔽The body of the three perfect connections is the body of the three, body, etc.

original: rang gi ngo bo snang ba gsum po rnams yang dag par sbyor ba ste 'dus pa'i sku gang yin pa der ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo snang ba gsum po rnams yang dag par sbyor ba ste 'dus pa'i sku gang yin pa der ro //
translated: The appearance of their own nature is the three perfect connections, i.e., the body that is the assembly of those three.

original: bsam pa ni man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni man ngag ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: The intention is just like the esoteric instructions.

original: snang ba zhes pa la sogs pas rang ti mug la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can de dag go //
analyzed: snang ba zhes pa la sogs pas rang ti mug la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can de dag go //
translated: Those, beginning with “appearance,” are the external and internal natures of delusion, etc.

original: ngo bo nyid ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i 'dod pa lnga po'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i 'dod pa lnga po'o //
translated: The nature is the five enjoyments of form, sound, etc.

original: ldang ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ldang ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The “arising, etc.,”

original: ldang ba la sogs pa'i rlung rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldang ba la sogs pa'i rlung rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are the winds of arising, etc., because they have the nature of form, etc.

original: ma lus par mthong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ni dbang po mtha' dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma lus par mthong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ni dbang po mtha' dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of seeing without exception, it is because of possessing all the faculties.

original: 'od gsal bar 'jug pa zhes pa ni sbyor ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal bar 'jug pa zhes pa ni sbyor ba'i don du'o //
translated: “Entering into clear light” is for the sake of union.

original: 'di'i ldang ba gsungs pa de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i ldang ba gsungs pa de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The arising from that is stated by “thus,” etc.

original: skad cig gi zhes pa ni gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: skad cig gi zhes pa ni gsungs pa yang /
translated: “In an instant” is also stated:

original: ye shes skad cig gis rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes brjod do zhes so //
analyzed: ye shes skad cig gis rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes brjod do zhes so //
translated: “The yoga of the instant perfection of pristine consciousness is said to be the instant yoga.”

original: langs pa'i rang gi ngo bo gsungs pa dbus zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: langs pa'i rang gi ngo bo gsungs pa dbus zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The nature of arising is stated by “middle,” etc.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi ni 'khor ba zhes pas sems can gyi don du sna tshogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams su kun du 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi ni 'khor ba zhes pas sems can gyi don du sna tshogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams su kun du 'gro bar byed do //
translated: Samsara and nirvana are samsara because it is the going everywhere to the various migrations for the sake of sentient beings.

original: skye bar byed do zhes pas 'khor ba ste 'gro ba'i rnam pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: skye bar byed do zhes pas 'khor ba ste 'gro ba'i rnam pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: It is samsara because it produces birth.

original: de nub par gyur pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de nub par gyur pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The nirvana is the disappearance of that.

original: dbus su ni bar skabs su'o //
analyzed: dbus su ni bar skabs su'o //
translated: In the middle is in the interval.

original: 'jug pa dang langs pa gnyis po dag la mngon par zhe na pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang langs pa gnyis po dag la mngon par zhe na pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no attachment to either entering or rising.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason it is said:

original: yod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Existence and nonexistence, etc.

original: shes par bya'o zhes pa ni yongs su shes pa nyid sgom par byed pa'o zhes mngon par dgongs so ;
analyzed: shes par bya'o zhes pa ni yongs su shes pa nyid sgom par byed pa'o zhes mngon par dgongs so ;
translated: Should be known means that one should meditate on the very knowledge.

original: ;'di nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni gsungs ma thag pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su rdzogs par bskyed pa'i rim pa 'di nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ;'di nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni gsungs ma thag pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su rdzogs par bskyed pa'i rim pa 'di nyid kyis so //
translated: This very means that by this very stage of the generation of the perfect Great Vajradhara who has just been taught.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi'ang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku nyid yongs su dag pas bskyed par ston par byed kyi bskyed pa'i rim pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi'ang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku nyid yongs su dag pas bskyed par ston par byed kyi bskyed pa'i rim pas ni ma yin te /
translated: The phrase Vairochana, etc., etc. indicates that the enjoyment body of Vairochana, etc. is also generated by the pure nature, but not by the generation stage.

original: thams cad kyi bskyed pa sngar gsungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi bskyed pa sngar gsungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the generation of all of them has already been taught.🔽What is the point of teaching this generation stage again for them?

original: slar yang de rnams la yang bskyed pa'i rim pa 'di bshad pa'i don ci ltar yin zhen gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang de rnams la yang bskyed pa'i rim pa 'di bshad pa'i don ci ltar yin zhen gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: bsam pa ji lta ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: according to their thoughts, etc., etc.

original: gang gis bsam pa rmongs pa la sogs pa'i sems @70b nyid gang yin pa de'i dbye bas khyad par gti mug la sogs pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can gti mug la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams sngar gsungs pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom par byed pa
analyzed: gang gis bsam pa rmongs pa la sogs pa'i sems @70b nyid gang yin pa de'i dbye bas khyad par gti mug la sogs pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can gti mug la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams sngar gsungs pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom par byed pa
translated: Those whose minds are confused, etc. by the divisions of that, the sentient beings who delight in the special ignorance, etc. are of the type of ignorance, etc. They meditate on the generation stage that has been taught previously.

original: rnams kyi rdzogs pa'i rim pa la yang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i gzugs su bskyed pa bstan to zhes pa bsam pa ji lta bas zhes pa 'di mngon par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnams kyi rdzogs pa'i rim pa la yang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i gzugs su bskyed pa bstan to zhes pa bsam pa ji lta bas zhes pa 'di mngon par dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the meaning of “according to one’s wish” is to be understood as the intended meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: And for that very reason, it is said:

original: rang gi don bya'o zhes te rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sku bzhi pa'o //🔽rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po ni /
analyzed: rang gi don bya'o zhes te rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sku bzhi pa'o // rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po ni /
translated: “one’s own aim is to be accomplished,” because it is the nature of the perfection of one’s own aim, the fourth Body.🔽The Great Seal of Vairochana

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po ste /
translated: is the Great Seal of Vairochana, etc.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan ma ni rdo rje gsum dbyer mi phyed ba'i ngo bo nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan ma ni rdo rje gsum dbyer mi phyed ba'i ngo bo nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: The sign of Body, Speech, and Mind is to be understood as the nature of the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sngar gsungs par rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ting nge 'dzin mchog tu 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sngar gsungs par rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ting nge 'dzin mchog tu 'dzin par byed do //
translated: That refers to the previously mentioned samadhis of Vairochana, etc. , which are held to be the supreme samadhi of Vajradhara.

original: aom dha rma dh'a tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bskyed pa'i rim pa gsungs pa las da ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: aom dha rma dh'a tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bskyed pa'i rim pa gsungs pa las da ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Oṃ dharmadhātu, etc. , refers to the previously mentioned stage of creation; now, the stage of completion is to be explained.

original: ci ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ci ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is it done?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / dharm ma dh'a tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / dharm ma dh'a tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Oṃ dharmadhātu, etc.

original: rang dbang yongs su spang bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang dbang yongs su spang bar gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that one should completely abandon self-control.

original: aom dharm ma dh'a tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa drug po gsungs so //
analyzed: aom dharm ma dh'a tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa drug po gsungs so //
translated: Oṃ dharmadhātu, etc. , refers to the six Tathagatas.

original: de nyid gsum du gcig tu gyur pa 'dir bshad pas ni 'od gsal du gzhug pa mngon par brjod par bya bzhin pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid gsum du gcig tu gyur pa 'dir bshad pas ni 'od gsal du gzhug pa mngon par brjod par bya bzhin pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the three realities are one here, it is explained that one should enter into clear light, because it is not the case that one should not speak.

original: de'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid gsum po gcig nyid do //
analyzed: de'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid gsum po gcig nyid do //
translated: Since it is the meaning of that, the three realities are one.

original: nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to //
translated: It is the definitive meaning.

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom par byed pa'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor bshad pa la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom par byed pa'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor bshad pa la 'jug par byed do //
translated: Now, beginning with “now,” he introduces the explanation of the subtle yoga for one who meditates on the creation stage.

original: brtan par bya ba'i don ni mi brtan pa brtan par byed pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: brtan par bya ba'i don ni mi brtan pa brtan par byed pa'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning of “stabilizing” is for the sake of stabilizing the unstable.

original: rnam pa gsum zhes pa ni dmigs pa'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum zhes pa ni dmigs pa'i dbye ba las so //
translated: “Three” is from the perspective of the division of the object.

original: phra mo zhes pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: phra mo zhes pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor la ltos pa'o //
translated: “Subtle” is in relation to the deity yoga.

original: kha dog lnga zhes pa ni rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma lnga ste /
analyzed: kha dog lnga zhes pa ni rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma lnga ste /
translated: “Five colors” are the five insignia such as the vajra.

original: so so re res nag po la sogs pa'i 'od zer lnga po rnams kyis tha snyad du bstan to //
analyzed: so so re res nag po la sogs pa'i 'od zer lnga po rnams kyis tha snyad du bstan to //
translated: Each one is conventionally taught by the five light rays such as black.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: rigs lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “five families,” and so on.

original: rin che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ni /
analyzed: rin che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ni /
translated: Because of being precious,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsam gyis mi khyab cing gzhal du med pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan nyid @71a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsam gyis mi khyab cing gzhal du med pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan nyid @71a * //
translated: the nature of the tathāgatas is inconceivable, immeasurable, and uncommon qualities.

original: las so // yungs kar zhes pa ni phra mo nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: las so // yungs kar zhes pa ni phra mo nyid ston par byed do //
translated: Mustard seed shows its smallness.

original: sna'i rtse mor ni rdo rje sna'i rtse mor te skyes bu la ltos nas gsungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna'i rtse mor ni rdo rje sna'i rtse mor te skyes bu la ltos nas gsungs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At the tip of the nose means at the tip of the vajra nose, because it is said in relation to the man.

original: nyin dang mtshan du zhes pa 'dis rgyun mi 'chad par goms par ston bar byed de /
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan du zhes pa 'dis rgyun mi 'chad par goms par ston bar byed de /
translated: Day and night shows its practice without interruption.

original: gzhan du na sems brtan par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na sems brtan par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the mind would not be stabilized.

original: gang gi cho zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems brtan par gyur par yongs su shes pa'i mtshan ma ston par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi cho zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems brtan par gyur par yongs su shes pa'i mtshan ma ston par byed do //
translated: By the verse beginning with “when” he shows the sign of knowing the mind to be stabilized.

original: mthong ba nyid ni dngos su phyi rol gyi dngos po zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba nyid ni dngos su phyi rol gyi dngos po zhes pa'o //
translated: Seeing itself is the external thing directly.

original: mtshan ma ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni rgyu'o //
translated: The sign is the cause.

original: sems brtan par gyur pa'i gzung ba ni mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: sems brtan par gyur pa'i gzung ba ni mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: The object of the stabilized mind is attachment.

original: phyogs dang po la sogs par mtshan mar dmigs nas dmigs pa gzhan la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang po la sogs par mtshan mar dmigs nas dmigs pa gzhan la mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Having observed the sign in the first part, etc., it does not enter into another object.

original: de ltar sems brtan par gyur par shes nas dbang du gyur pa nyid bskyed pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar sems brtan par gyur par shes nas dbang du gyur pa nyid bskyed pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: Having understood that the mind has become stable in that way, in order to generate mastery, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: de'i cho zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i cho zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The procedure for that” and so forth.

original: spro bar bya zhes pa ni mtshan ma bsgom pa la slob bzhin pa nyid mtshan ma las mtshan mar spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: spro bar bya zhes pa ni mtshan ma bsgom pa la slob bzhin pa nyid mtshan ma las mtshan mar spro bar bya'o //
translated: “One should emanate” means that one who is training in the meditation on the sign should emanate from the sign the sign.

original: 'od zer las skyes pa'i 'od zer dang bcas pa'o //🔽brtan par ma gyur zhes pa la sogs pa ni bsgom pa la slob bzhin pa'i sgom par byed pa'i brtan par ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer las skyes pa'i 'od zer dang bcas pa'o // brtan par ma gyur zhes pa la sogs pa ni bsgom pa la slob bzhin pa'i sgom par byed pa'i brtan par ma gyur pa'o //
translated: [The sign] is endowed with light rays born from light rays.

original: spro bar mi bya'o ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir sems brtan par yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: spro bar mi bya'o ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir sems brtan par yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: “One should not emanate” means that one who is training in meditation, whose meditation has not become stable, should not emanate, because the mind will not become stable due to distraction.

original: slar yang yang dag par bsgoms nas spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang yang dag par bsgoms nas spro bar bya'o //
translated: Having again properly meditated, one should emanate.

original: phyag rgya chen po ni lha'i sku'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni lha'i sku'o //
translated: The “great seal” is the deity’s body.

original: lhan cig gi sku la spro ba dbang du gyur pa'i de ma thag tu mtha' yas pa yang spro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: lhan cig gi sku la spro ba dbang du gyur pa'i de ma thag tu mtha' yas pa yang spro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Having emanated into the deity’s body, immediately after mastery, one should emanate infinitely.

original: rab mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The supreme and so forth.

original: dkar po la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas spros pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs rnams rigs lnga nyid du ston par byed kyi rigs gcig pa nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas spros pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshogs rnams rigs lnga nyid du ston par byed kyi rigs gcig pa nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: The white and so forth indicate the emanated hosts of Buddhas as the five clans, but not as one clan.

original: 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pas mtshan ma dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pas mtshan ma dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: The wheel and so forth indicate the possession of signs.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas rigs lnga las skyes par ston par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas rigs lnga las skyes par ston par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattvas and so forth indicate the birth from the five clans.

original: nye bar mtshon pas zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gnas pa ma gsungs pa rnams dang / dkyil 'khor du gnas pa ma yin pa gzhan yang ston par byed do //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pas zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gnas pa ma gsungs pa rnams dang / dkyil 'khor du gnas pa ma yin pa gzhan yang ston par byed do //
translated: The illustration and so forth indicate the other abodes of the mandala and those not mentioned as abodes of the mandala.

original: spro ba'i bdag nyid can gyis spro bar byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: spro ba'i bdag nyid can gyis spro bar byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the nature of the emanation of the emanation-nature.

original: nam mkha' khyab par zhes pa ni nam mkha'i go skabs steng dang 'phred dang 'og tu'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' khyab par zhes pa ni nam mkha'i go skabs steng dang 'phred dang 'og tu'o //
translated: The pervading space is the space-interval above, across, and below.

original: spyi'i don no ni dmigs @71b bar bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa dag bskyed pa'i rim pas bsdus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i don no ni dmigs @71b bar bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa dag bskyed pa'i rim pas bsdus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The general meaning is that the object of observation and the observer are included in the generation stage.

original: rin chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The jewel is the nature of the five transcendent ones.

original: byang chub kyi sems te de bzhin nyid rtogs pa'i rgyud nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems te de bzhin nyid rtogs pa'i rgyud nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhicitta is the cause of realizing suchness.

original: yungs kar zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: yungs kar zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The mustard seed is as before.

original: gang yang 'gro bar byed do 'jug par byed do zhes pa ste pa ste rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: gang yang 'gro bar byed do 'jug par byed do zhes pa ste pa ste rlung gi khams so //
translated: That which moves, that which enters, is the wind element.

original: khams gsum dang ldan pa de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: khams gsum dang ldan pa de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since it has the nature of the three realms,

original: yungs kar te de'i 'bras bu'i tshad nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi sems kyi tshad ni yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam mo //
analyzed: yungs kar te de'i 'bras bu'i tshad nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi sems kyi tshad ni yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam mo //
translated: the mustard seed is the size of its fruit. The size of the bodhicitta is the size of a mustard seed.

original: rdo rje'i khar zhes pa ni rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma lngar gsungs pa sgom par byed pa'i stobs las de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can du byas nas so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i khar zhes pa ni rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma lngar gsungs pa sgom par byed pa'i stobs las de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can du byas nas so //
translated: On the vajra means that having made oneself into the nature of the five Tathagatas by the power of meditating on the five signs such as the vajra, etc.,

original: gzhan du na rdo rje'i kha nyid du gnas par mi 'gyur ro //🔽slar yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga sgom par byed pa'i bdag nyid can nyid kyis ga las 'gyur de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can du shes so //🔽spyan ma la sogs pa dang khro bo gnod mdzes la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽brtan pa zhes pa la sogs pas phyag rgya mnyes par byed pa dang rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa mngon par gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan du na rdo rje'i kha nyid du gnas par mi 'gyur ro // slar yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga sgom par byed pa'i bdag nyid can nyid kyis ga las 'gyur de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can du shes so // spyan ma la sogs pa dang khro bo gnod mdzes la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can nyid kyi phyir ro // brtan pa zhes pa la sogs pas phyag rgya mnyes par byed pa dang rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa mngon par gsungs so //
translated: otherwise one would not remain on the vajra itself.🔽Again, by the very nature of meditating on the five Tathagatas, one should know that one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas.

original: ji ltar gsungs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'gro ba'i rgyud du gsal bar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'gro ba'i rgyud du gsal bar ro //
translated: Because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the five Tathagatas, because of being of the nature of the five Tathagatas, one is of the nature of the

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang /
translated: The maṇḍala wheel

original: bu ni drug pa'i ste de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po rnams dkyil 'khor gyi dbang phyug nyid du rdzogs pa lnga po rnams kyang drug pa nyid kyis rgyas 'debs par 'ched par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bu ni drug pa'i ste de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po rnams dkyil 'khor gyi dbang phyug nyid du rdzogs pa lnga po rnams kyang drug pa nyid kyis rgyas 'debs par 'ched par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: is the sixth son, and the five tathāgatas are the five perfections in the state of the lord of the maṇḍala. The five are also sealed by the sixth.

original: dkyil 'khor ba gang yin pa nyid ni cha bo nyid de de ltar na spyan ma la sogs pa rnams tsha bo nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba gang yin pa nyid ni cha bo nyid de de ltar na spyan ma la sogs pa rnams tsha bo nyid kho na'o //
translated: That which is the maṇḍala is the uncle, and thus Locanā, etc., are the aunts.🔽The hidden

original: sbas pa'o // lnga zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sbas pa'o // lnga zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: is the five, etc.🔽The five are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five aggregates.🔽The five aggregates are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rin po che bskyed pa'i phyir zhes pa ni mi shigs par sgom par byed pa 'od gsal du 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽thig le'i gzugs can yin pa nyid las ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' la gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rin po che bskyed pa'i phyir zhes pa ni mi shigs par sgom par byed pa 'od gsal du 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽thig le'i gzugs can yin pa nyid las ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' la gnas pa nyid do //
translated: The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the five buddhas.🔽The five buddhas are the five buddhas, and the five buddhas are the

original: ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' nyid thig ler gyur pa mi shigs par gyur pa ma yin no zhes su zhig 'dod /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' nyid thig ler gyur pa mi shigs par gyur pa ma yin no zhes su zhig 'dod /
translated: Who would assert that the concentration being itself becomes the drop, and becomes indestructible?

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: snying ga'i padma'i lte bar ni ye shes sems dpa'i @72a * //
analyzed: snying ga'i padma'i lte bar ni ye shes sems dpa'i @72a * //
translated: In the center of the heart lotus,

original: snying ga'i padma'i lte bar ro //
analyzed: snying ga'i padma'i lte bar ro //
translated: in the center of the heart lotus.

original: 'jug pa zhes pa la sogs pas mi shigs pas 'jug pa la sogs pa gsum po ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes pa la sogs pas mi shigs pas 'jug pa la sogs pa gsum po ston par byed do //
translated: By “entering” and so forth, he shows the three, entering and so forth, by way of the indestructible.

original: bsdu ba zhes pa la sogs pa gsum po rnams 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba zhes pa la sogs pa gsum po rnams 'gog pa'o //
translated: By “gathering” and so forth, he stops the three.

original: nyin dang mtshan mor zhes pa 'dis rnam par ma chad par goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mor zhes pa 'dis rnam par ma chad par goms par byed pa'o //
translated: By “day and night,” he practices without interruption.

original: rtag tu zhes pa ni 'gog pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes pa ni 'gog pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: “Always” is by the nature of the essence of cessation.

original: mi shigs pa ni rnam par rtogs pa'i dra ba thams cad bcom nas med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi shigs pa ni rnam par rtogs pa'i dra ba thams cad bcom nas med par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Indestructible” is the absence of all the nets of conceptuality.

original: slar yang 'di ldang bar byed pa rlung gi sgo nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang 'di ldang bar byed pa rlung gi sgo nas gsungs pa /
translated: Again, he speaks of rising from that by way of the wind:

original: de'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, and so forth.

original: brtan par ma gyur pa ni brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rtag par ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: brtan par ma gyur pa ni brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rtag par ma gyur pa'o //
translated: “Not stabilized” means not made permanent by the characteristics of expression.

original: gang gi tshe mi shigs pa'i de kho na nyid lhag par rtogs pa nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe mi shigs pa'i thig le'i gzugs stong pa nyid gsal bar byed pa po de'i de kho na nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi shigs pa'i de kho na nyid lhag par rtogs pa nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe mi shigs pa'i thig le'i gzugs stong pa nyid gsal bar byed pa po de'i de kho na nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: When one has realized the supreme reality of the indestructible, then the reality of that which is the form of the indestructible drop, the illuminator of emptiness, is emptiness.

original: de rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: That is the realization itself.

original: thig le sgom par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thig le sgom par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of meditating on the drop is like that.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i 'od ni 'od zer lnga'i bdag nyid can gyis so //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i 'od ni 'od zer lnga'i bdag nyid can gyis so //
translated: “With light” means with the nature of the five lights.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Maṇḍala” means the nature of the tathāgatas Akṣobhya and so on and the goddesses Locanā and so on.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
translated: Also, it will be explained:

original: g-yas pa nas ni byung ba'i rlung /
analyzed: g-yas pa nas ni byung ba'i rlung /
translated: The wind that arises from the right

original: me yi dkyil 'khor nyid yin te /
analyzed: me yi dkyil 'khor nyid yin te /
translated: is the maṇḍala of fire.

original: kha dog dmar zhing gsal ba 'dir //
analyzed: kha dog dmar zhing gsal ba 'dir //
translated: Here, the red, clear color

original: padma gon po rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: padma gon po rgyu ba'o //
translated: is the movement of the lotus.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: bzhi po rnams kyis ni me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang chu rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bzhi po rnams kyis ni me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang chu rnams kyis so //
translated: By the four, by fire, wind, earth, and water.

original: g-yas pa la sogs pa zhes pa'i sogs pa'i sgras g-yon dang steng dang 'og dang dbus rnams gzung ste /
analyzed: g-yas pa la sogs pa zhes pa'i sogs pa'i sgras g-yon dang steng dang 'og dang dbus rnams gzung ste /
translated: In the right and so on, the word and so on includes the left, above, below, and middle.

original: sna'i bu ga re re la'o //
analyzed: sna'i bu ga re re la'o //
translated: In each nostril.

original: spro bar bya zhes pa ni rang gi dang nyid kyis nges par 'gro ba'am mdzes par bzlas par 'dod pa la ltos nas spro bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: spro bar bya zhes pa ni rang gi dang nyid kyis nges par 'gro ba'am mdzes par bzlas par 'dod pa la ltos nas spro bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: One should emit, it is said, in dependence on one's own nature, or in dependence on the desire to recite beautifully.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprin gyis zhes pa ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprin gyis zhes pa ni //
translated: By the cloud of Tathagatas means

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i do bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor bzhi po ste gang yang dkyil 'khor bzhi la sgom pa dbang du gyur pa thob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprin gyis chos kyi chu'i char 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i do bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor bzhi po ste gang yang dkyil 'khor bzhi la sgom pa dbang du gyur pa thob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprin gyis chos kyi chu'i char 'bebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: by the cloud of the four mandalas, because they have the nature of the Tathagatas. Whoever attains mastery in the meditation on the four mandalas will cause the cloud of Tathagatas to rain down the water of Dharma.

original: sprin rnams kyis zhes pa mang po'i tshig las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mang po nyid do //
analyzed: sprin rnams kyis zhes pa mang po'i tshig las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mang po nyid do //
translated: The clouds are many, and the Tathagatas are many, from the plural word.

original: de'i phyir gsungs @72b pa ;
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs @72b pa ;
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Space, etc.

original: mthar thug pa'o zhes pa 'od gsal du zhugs pa dang ldang ba dag gi mthar thug pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'o zhes pa 'od gsal du zhugs pa dang ldang ba dag gi mthar thug pa rnam pa gnyis kyis bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The final is the final of the entry into and the arising from the clear light, explained as the two aspects.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa la bskyed pa'i rim pa zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim par bskyed pa ni sngar bstan pa nyid kyi phyir bskyed pa zhes pa la sogs pas khyad par du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa la bskyed pa'i rim pa zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim par bskyed pa ni sngar bstan pa nyid kyi phyir bskyed pa zhes pa la sogs pas khyad par du byed pa'o //
translated: Vairochana, etc. The generation stage is the generation in the completion stage, because it has been taught previously. The generation, etc. is the distinction.

original: sbyor ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa rten de sgrub pa po la sbyor bar byed do zhes pa sbyor ba ste de nyid kyi dkyil 'khor te zhi ba can la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs kyi nges par bskor ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa rten de sgrub pa po la sbyor bar byed do zhes pa sbyor ba ste de nyid kyi dkyil 'khor te zhi ba can la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs kyi nges par bskor ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The mandala of application is the application of that support to the adept. The application is the mandala, because it is the circle of the collection of actions such as pacification, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the vajra cross.

original: de las zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: From that, etc.

original: de rdo rje las byung ba zhes bar ma chad par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rdo rje las byung ba zhes bar ma chad par sbyar ro //
translated: From that vajra, the vajra-born, without interruption, is to be applied.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ba sku zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ba sku zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: These, etc.

original: sku la sogs pa rnams kyi sgrub pa ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa rnams kyi sgrub pa ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the body, etc. is the meditation.

original: 'di ni sku la sogs pa rnams kyis so so re re las 'brel pa'i phyir mang po nyid de de nyid kyi phyir sgrub pa rnams kyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni sku la sogs pa rnams kyis so so re re las 'brel pa'i phyir mang po nyid de de nyid kyi phyir sgrub pa rnams kyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is the multiplicity of the body, etc. because of the connection with each one of them. Therefore, it is said, the accomplishments.

original: thugs sgrub pa la sku dang gsungs yang thugs kyi nang du son pa nyid kyis yon tan dang ldan par gyur par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs sgrub pa la sku dang gsungs yang thugs kyi nang du son pa nyid kyis yon tan dang ldan par gyur par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the accomplishment of the mind, the body and speech are also endowed with good qualities by being contained within the mind.

original: sku nyid dkyil 'khor yin pas sku'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: sku nyid dkyil 'khor yin pas sku'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The body itself is the mandala, therefore, the body mandala.🔽What is that?

original: de gang zhe na zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor la ltos pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de gang zhe na zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor la ltos pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: This is in connection with the mandala.

original: rdo rje las byung ba zhes pa ni rdo rje'i mtshan ma las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje las byung ba zhes pa ni rdo rje'i mtshan ma las byung ba'o //
translated: The phrase arisen from the vajra means arisen from the vajra sign.

original: de rnams zhes sngar gsungs pa 'dir brel lo //
analyzed: de rnams zhes sngar gsungs pa 'dir brel lo //
translated: The phrase those refers to the previously mentioned ones.

original: rab kyi mchog ni rab tu phul du byung ba dang mchog de gtso bo'o //
analyzed: rab kyi mchog ni rab tu phul du byung ba dang mchog de gtso bo'o //
translated: The phrase the best of the best means the most excellent of the best, the foremost.

original: drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: drang ba'i don to //
translated: This is the interpretable meaning explanation.

original: de ltar bskyed pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lnga po rnams kyi bskyed pa ma ngon par brjod nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar bskyed pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lnga po rnams kyi bskyed pa ma ngon par brjod nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Having thus described the generation of the five, Vairochana and so on, by way of the generation stage, in order to teach the completion stage, [the Bhagavān] declares, the mandala of the moon, and so on.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi zhes pa la sogs pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te dkar po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang zlum po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi zhes pa la sogs pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te dkar po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang zlum po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mandala of the moon is like a moon disk, because it is white and round.

original: mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa ni bdag po nyid yin pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa ni bdag po nyid yin pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: The essence of Akshobhya is declared because Akshobhya is the lord.

original: kha dog dkar po ni 'di la ldan par gsungs pa /
analyzed: kha dog dkar po ni 'di la ldan par gsungs pa /
translated: The phrase white-colored declares that it is endowed with that.

original: chu'i khams rgyu ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu'i khams rgyu ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the water element is in motion.

original: chu'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid m'a ma ka'i nag mo'o //🔽yang na rlung gi de nyid kyi kha dog @73a * //
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid m'a ma ka'i nag mo'o // yang na rlung gi de nyid kyi kha dog @73a * //
translated: The essence of the water element is Māmakī, the black one.

original: gzhan nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or else, the color of the wind element is not different.

original: gal te de ltar na me'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin 'od dpag med dang gos dkar mo dag ci'i phyir kha dog dmar po nyid yin gyi kha dog nag po nyid du mi 'gyur ba ci zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na me'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin 'od dpag med dang gos dkar mo dag ci'i phyir kha dog dmar po nyid yin gyi kha dog nag po nyid du mi 'gyur ba ci zhes pa'o //
translated: If it were so, why is Amitābha, the nature of the fire maṇḍala, and Pāṇḍaravāsinī red in color, and not black in color?

original: de'i phyir chu'i khams rgyu ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chu'i khams rgyu ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that “because the water element is in motion.”

original: thams cad gzhogs 'ga' zhig tu kun du zhum pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten du yang 'ga' zhig de ma yin par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dang de zhes brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad gzhogs 'ga' zhig tu kun du zhum pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten du yang 'ga' zhig de ma yin par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dang de zhes brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Because it is not the case that everything is completely depressed in some direction, it is to be said that “that and that” are not nonexistent in the world.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur bzhin pa ni rang gi dang nyid do //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur bzhin pa ni rang gi dang nyid do //
translated: That which is in the process of arising is its own nature.

original: shes par bya'o zhes pa ni yongs su shes pa nyid rgyun chags par 'di dang de bzhin du gzhan du yang bsgom pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes par bya'o zhes pa ni yongs su shes pa nyid rgyun chags par 'di dang de bzhin du gzhan du yang bsgom pa nyid do //
translated: “One should know” means that one should cultivate the very same complete knowledge in a continuous manner, and in the same way, in other places as well.

original: kha dog ser po dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin spyan ma dkar mo ma yin nam /
analyzed: kha dog ser po dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin spyan ma dkar mo ma yin nam /
translated: “The yellow color is the maṇḍala of the great lord” means that the nature of the earth element is white Locanā.🔽How could it be yellow here?

original: de ci ltar 'dir ser po nyid yin zhes bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de ci ltar 'dir ser po nyid yin zhes bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should think about this.

original: thad kar gzhogs gnyis su dang steng dang 'og rnam pa gnyis las lha re re rgyu ba'i phyir gnyis ka las 'byung bar 'gyur bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: thad kar gzhogs gnyis su dang steng dang 'og rnam pa gnyis las lha re re rgyu ba'i phyir gnyis ka las 'byung bar 'gyur bzhin pa'o //
translated: Since each of the gods moves in two directions—straight ahead, to the two sides, above, and below—they are said to move in all directions.

original: kha dog nag po don yod grub pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: kha dog nag po don yod grub pa zhes pa ni /
translated: “The black color is Amoghasiddhi” means

original: kha dog ljang ser lta bu ste /
analyzed: kha dog ljang ser lta bu ste /
translated: that the color is like a light green.

original: las kyi mgon 'dir lha nyid do //
analyzed: las kyi mgon 'dir lha nyid do //
translated: This is the god Karma-Vajra.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: This is stated.

original: ljang khu nyid du gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ljang khu nyid du gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t green stated?

original: sdo bsangs kyi sgra 'di nag po'i rnam grangs yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sdo bsangs kyi sgra 'di nag po'i rnam grangs yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault because the word “dark” is a synonym for “black.”

original: lus la sogs pa rnams rlung dang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa rnams rlung dang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,

original: sku zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sku zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,

original: lha'i 'khor lo ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lnga po thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang gi mthar thug par bzhugs pa 'bras bu'i ngo bo'o //🔽thob par 'dod pa ni lam la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lha'i 'khor lo ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lnga po thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang gi mthar thug par bzhugs pa 'bras bu'i ngo bo'o // thob par 'dod pa ni lam la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,

original: sku zhes bya ba ni bshad pa byed pa rnams kyi sku zhes mngon par brjod par bya ba 'dis ni gcig po 'di'i sku gcig kho na'o //🔽gsal bar zhes pa ni bya ba'i khyad par ro //🔽thog ma dang tha ma med pa ni skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku zhes bya ba ni bshad pa byed pa rnams kyi sku zhes mngon par brjod par bya ba 'dis ni gcig po 'di'i sku gcig kho na'o // gsal bar zhes pa ni bya ba'i khyad par ro // thog ma dang tha ma med pa ni skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,

original: rnal 'byor ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth,🔽The wheel of the deities is the body and so forth

original: phra mo zhes pa ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa po dang / dmigs par byed pa la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phra mo zhes pa ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa po dang / dmigs par byed pa la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Subtle means that it is not an object of observation, an observer, or an act of observing.

original: mi gsal ba @73b ni de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mi gsal ba @73b ni de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can nyid kyis so //
translated: Unmanifest means that it is the nature of suchness.

original: gsal bar yang dag sbyor ni gsal ba gzugs kyi rnam pa bzhin du de nyid sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa gsal ba yang dag sbyor ro //
analyzed: gsal bar yang dag sbyor ni gsal ba gzugs kyi rnam pa bzhin du de nyid sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa gsal ba yang dag sbyor ro //
