translated: Correct application as manifest means that it is applied as manifest, like a form.

original: ngo bo nyid med ces pa la sogs pas yongs su dag pa'i gzugs 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med ces pa la sogs pas yongs su dag pa'i gzugs 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is the pure form that is taught by the words “without intrinsic reality,” and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dus thams cad du 'di nyid gnyug ma'i rnam pa yin gyi gang gis cung zad kyang bya ba ma yin gyi rnal 'byor pas yongs su shes par bya ba de'o zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dus thams cad du 'di nyid gnyug ma'i rnam pa yin gyi gang gis cung zad kyang bya ba ma yin gyi rnal 'byor pas yongs su shes par bya ba de'o zhes ston par byed do //
translated: By nature means that this is the natural form of all times, and nothing else is to be done by the yogi.

original: rang po gcig ni dang po nyid bden pa gnyis po gcig gi ngo bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rang po gcig ni dang po nyid bden pa gnyis po gcig gi ngo bor gyur pa'o //
translated: One nature means that the two truths have one nature.

original: gcig dang ni gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo so //
analyzed: gcig dang ni gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo so //
translated: The nature of non-duality is one.

original: du mas ni bden pa gnyis kyi ngo bos spangs pa'o //
analyzed: du mas ni bden pa gnyis kyi ngo bos spangs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the two truths is many.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos zhes grags //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos zhes grags //
translated: It is known as the Dharma of dependent origination.

original: zhes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin chu zla lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin chu zla lta bu ste /
translated: The nature of the Dharma of dependent origination is like the moon in water.

original: rang gi ngo bo chu zla lta bu nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo chu zla lta bu nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its own nature is non-arising, like the moon in water.🔽Or, like the moon of truth that arises correctly in clear water and in the cloudless sky.

original: yang na rnyog ma med pa'i chu yod pa dang nam mkha'i sprin dang bral bar zla ba yang dag par nye bar skyes pa'i bden pa'i zla ba lta bus so sor rtogs te /
analyzed: yang na rnyog ma med pa'i chu yod pa dang nam mkha'i sprin dang bral bar zla ba yang dag par nye bar skyes pa'i bden pa'i zla ba lta bus so sor rtogs te /
translated: It is realized individually.

original: thams cad du yang de ni gnyug ma'i ngo bo nyid kyis gdod ma nas skye ba med do //
analyzed: thams cad du yang de ni gnyug ma'i ngo bo nyid kyis gdod ma nas skye ba med do //
translated: Everywhere, it is primordially non-arisen by its own intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar yongs su dag pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po ye shes kyi zla ba rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos su rab tu brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su dag pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po ye shes kyi zla ba rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos su rab tu brtag par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the completely pure Great Vajradhara should be fully understood as the Dharma of dependent origination, the moon of wisdom.

original: dngos po kun gyi 'byung gnas gcig ni dngos po kun ni sems can dang snod du grags pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi 'byung gnas gcig ni dngos po kun ni sems can dang snod du grags pa rnams su'o //
translated: The one source of all things is all things, which are known as sentient beings and the world.

original: gcig ces pa ni 'byung gnas gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: gcig ces pa ni 'byung gnas gcig kho na'o //
translated: The one is the one source alone.

original: zla ba gcig kho na kha dog la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i chu'i snod gcig tu shar ba'i gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
analyzed: zla ba gcig kho na kha dog la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i chu'i snod gcig tu shar ba'i gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
translated: Like the reflection of the moon in a single vessel of water, which has various colors, etc.

original: bdag nyid ces pa la sogs pa la 'di ltar zhes pa ni gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid du'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces pa la sogs pa la 'di ltar zhes pa ni gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid du'o //
translated: As for the words “one should make oneself,” etc., “thus” refers to the previously stated characteristics.

original: byas nas ni bskyed nas so //
analyzed: byas nas ni bskyed nas so //
translated: Having made, having generated.

original: ci bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What should one do? He says:

original: bri bar bya zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bri bar bya zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: One should draw, etc.

original: chos kyi dkyil 'khor ni a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan pa'i chos rnams ni chos so //
analyzed: chos kyi dkyil 'khor ni a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan pa'i chos rnams ni chos so //
translated: The Dharma maṇḍala is the maṇḍala of the Dharma because it is the nature of ālikāli.

original: dkyil 'khor bzhi'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhi'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: It is a maṇḍala because it has the nature of the four maṇḍalas.

original: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs /
translated: The extensive explanation of this is stated.

original: dmar po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dmar po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Red, etc.

original: 'dis mi'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis mi'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa mngon par brjod do //
translated: This expresses the mandala of men, and so on.

original: bzhi zhes pa la sogs @74a * //
analyzed: bzhi zhes pa la sogs @74a * //
translated: With four, etc.,

original: pas dkyil 'khor re re la dkyil 'khor bzhi po bri bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: pas dkyil 'khor re re la dkyil 'khor bzhi po bri bar shes par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that each mandala is drawn with four mandalas.

original: gos dkar la sogs pa'i rang bzhin me'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gos dkar la sogs pa'i rang bzhin me'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of Pāṇḍarā, etc., is the fire mandala, etc.

original: rang gi lta ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid can yi ge gsum rang gi lha nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi lta ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid can yi ge gsum rang gi lha nyid do //
translated: One's own deity is the three syllables with the nature of Mahāvajradhara.

original: 'di'i gzhi ni dkyil 'khor bzhi'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i gzhi ni dkyil 'khor bzhi'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The basis of this is the union of the four mandalas.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba nyid gos 'phang mchog ste mchog gi go 'phang gi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba nyid gos 'phang mchog ste mchog gi go 'phang gi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supreme state is the cause of the supreme state.

original: steng zhes pa la sogs pas rgyu'i gnas mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: steng zhes pa la sogs pas rgyu'i gnas mngon par brjod do //
translated: With above, etc., the place of the cause is expressed.🔽 With fire, etc., the rites of subjugation, etc., based on the mandalas of fire, etc., are expressed.

original: me zhes pa la sogs pas me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la brten nas dbang la sogs pa'i las mngon par brjod do zhes gsungs so zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dgos pa lung ston du'o //
analyzed: me zhes pa la sogs pas me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la brten nas dbang la sogs pa'i las mngon par brjod do zhes gsungs so zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dgos pa lung ston du'o //
translated: This is the prophecy of the Bhagavān's purpose.

original: lha zhes bya ba la sogs pas lha la dmigs pas skye ba med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba la sogs pas lha la dmigs pas skye ba med par gyur pa'o //
translated: The gods and so on are the objects of observation for the generation of the non-existent.

original: khyad par can ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ci yang mi bya'o zhes slob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ci yang mi bya'o zhes slob par byed pa'o //
translated: The special is the teaching of do not do anything at all, which will be explained.

original: bsgrub pa'i khyad par can rnams la phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gsum bsgoms pa las skyes pa sems kyi khyad par rnam pa gsum thob pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i khyad par can rnams la phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gsum bsgoms pa las skyes pa sems kyi khyad par rnam pa gsum thob pa'o //
translated: The special attainment is the attainment of the three types of special mind generated from the meditation of the three types of subtle yoga.

original: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni yid la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bdun po ru ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni yid la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bdun po ru ni ma yin no //
translated: The sand-colored mandala is not the seven mandalas of the mind and so on.

original: dbang bskur ba'i phyir zhes pa ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gsum bsgom pa las skyes pas thob pa bye brag rnam pa gsum gyi rjes su mthun par dbang bskur ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i phyir zhes pa ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gsum bsgom pa las skyes pas thob pa bye brag rnam pa gsum gyi rjes su mthun par dbang bskur ba'i don to //
translated: The initiation is the special initiation that is in accordance with the three types of attainment that are generated from the meditation of the three types of subtle yoga.

original: gsol ba 'debs pa zhes pa ni slob dpon dang bla mar gyur pa dag gis bslab pa'o //
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa zhes pa ni slob dpon dang bla mar gyur pa dag gis bslab pa'o //
translated: The supplication is the training of the masters and gurus.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'i //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'i //
translated: The literal one.

original: rgyud 'di la ni sems gtso bo'i phyir thog mar thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs la /
analyzed: rgyud 'di la ni sems gtso bo'i phyir thog mar thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs la /
translated: Since mind is primary in this tantra, therefore it is said, “At the outset, all…” and so forth.

original: de nas gzugs kyi phyung po rags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas gzugs kyi phyung po rags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Then, since the aggregate of form is coarse, therefore it is said, “Peace…” and so forth.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po la ltos nas tshor ba'i phung po rags pas da'i lag par tshor ba dang nga'i rkang par tshor ro zhes smra bar byed pas rags par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po la ltos nas tshor ba'i phung po rags pas da'i lag par tshor ba dang nga'i rkang par tshor ro zhes smra bar byed pas rags par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In dependence on the aggregate of discrimination, the aggregate of feeling is coarse, because one says, “I feel in my hand,” and “I feel in my foot.” Therefore, in order to teach the coarse,

original: de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: after that it is said, “All the Tathagatas…” and so forth.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po la ltos nas 'du shes rags so zhes pas chos kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes pa ni phung po bstan pa'i rim pas gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po la ltos nas 'du shes rags so zhes pas chos kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes pa ni phung po bstan pa'i rim pas gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: In dependence on the aggregate of compositional factors, discrimination is coarse. Therefore, it is said, “All phenomena…” and so forth. This is the supplication in terms of the sequence of the aggregates.

original: rigs gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: rigs gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
translated: By the nature of the three families,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang rdo rje dang padma dang rigs @74b gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang rdo rje dang padma dang rigs @74b gsum mo //
translated: there are three families: the Tathagata family, the vajra family, and the lotus family.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas drug pa'i bstod pa gsungs par de drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas drug pa'i bstod pa gsungs par de drang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the praise of the sixth [buddha] by the Tathāgata should be interpreted as by nature.

original: gsol ba 'debs pa'i don gang zhen de gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa'i don gang zhen de gsungs pa /
translated: What is the meaning of the request? He says, All... and so on.

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi zhes bya ba gsungs pas /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi zhes bya ba gsungs pas /
translated: Since it is the nature of the Tathāgata, he says of the maṇḍala, and so on.

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: All... and so on.

original: ji skad du bshad pa zhes pa ni le'u 'di nyid du 'chang par 'gyur ba dang / de nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud la sogs par ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa zhes pa ni le'u 'di nyid du 'chang par 'gyur ba dang / de nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud la sogs par ro //
translated: As explained means in this very chapter, will be held, and in the Tattvasamgraha Tantra, and so on.

original: kun du bzang po zhes pa ni gal te yang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor dang / ldan ba'i sngags pa yang 'dir de bzhin du yang drug par yang dag par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: kun du bzang po zhes pa ni gal te yang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor dang / ldan ba'i sngags pa yang 'dir de bzhin du yang drug par yang dag par rtogs par byed do //
translated: Samantabhadra means that even if one is a mantra practitioner endowed with the yoga of Akṣobhya, and so on, here one should realize it as the sixth.

original: sku'i mchog ni sems can gyi 'jig rten ma lus pa'i skul ltos nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mchog gnyis yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi sku'i mchog nyid do //
analyzed: sku'i mchog ni sems can gyi 'jig rten ma lus pa'i skul ltos nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mchog gnyis yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi sku'i mchog nyid do //
translated: The supreme body is the supreme body of the Tathagata, in dependence on the bodies of all worlds of sentient beings, and it is the supreme body of the mandala, because it is the nature of that.

original: dam pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi phul du byung ba'o //
translated: The best is the best of forms and so forth.

original: zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor dang sbrel lo //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor dang sbrel lo //
translated: The words “peaceful” and so forth are connected to the mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor yang de las skyes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor yang de las skyes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mandala is also born from that, because

original: 'od gsal ba las yang dag 'byung /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba las yang dag 'byung /
translated: it arises from clear light.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bde chen po //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bde chen po //
translated: The great bliss of Vajrasattva

original: gzugs brnyan lha bu yang nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan lha bu yang nyid do //
translated: is also the son of the deity, the reflection.

original: dkyil 'khor yang ni de dang mtshungs //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor yang ni de dang mtshungs //
translated: The mandala is also like that.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated.

original: slar yang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bor bshad pas bstod pa /
analyzed: slar yang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bor bshad pas bstod pa /
translated: Again, it is praised by explaining it as the nature of Great Vajradhara.

original: de'i spyod pa zhes pa ni ye shes gsum po de'i spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i spyod pa zhes pa ni ye shes gsum po de'i spyod pa ste /
translated: The conduct of that is the conduct of those three exalted wisdoms.

original: spyad par bya'o rtogs par bya'o zhes byas nas spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spyad par bya'o rtogs par bya'o zhes byas nas spyod pa'o //
translated: Having said, “I will practice, I will realize,” he practices.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rang bzhin brgya drug cu'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rang bzhin brgya drug cu'o //
translated: Attachment and so forth are the one hundred and sixty natures.

original: snang ba gsum gyi rtags nyid yin pa'i phyir //🔽rang bzhin rnams spyod bar mdzad do zhes ba rang bzhin skye ba dang dus mtshungs pa kho nar thog ma med cing tha ma med pa'i mngon par byang chub pa dran pas rang gi sems so sor rtogs te bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa nyid du yongs
analyzed: snang ba gsum gyi rtags nyid yin pa'i phyir // rang bzhin rnams spyod bar mdzad do zhes ba rang bzhin skye ba dang dus mtshungs pa kho nar thog ma med cing tha ma med pa'i mngon par byang chub pa dran pas rang gi sems so sor rtogs te bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa nyid du yongs
translated: Because they are the signs of the three appearances,🔽he practices the natures.🔽He remembers the self-consecration that is beginningless and endless, and he realizes his own mind as the nonduality of the two truths.

original: su shes so //
analyzed: su shes so //
translated: Through that, he fully understands.

original: de'i sgo nas zhes pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas zhes pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “Through that” means through its nature.

original: snying po ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: snying po ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The essence is nonabiding nirvana.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir gsungs pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir gsungs pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because it is its nature, he says, “That” and so forth.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang gi ngo bo ston par byed pa de'i zhes pa @75a * //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang gi ngo bo ston par byed pa de'i zhes pa @75a * //
translated: “That” is the one who teaches the nature of Mahāvajradhara.

original: la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: la sogs pa ste /
translated: “That” and so forth.

original: rnam pa ni 'di rang bzhin no zhes pa bsten pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni 'di rang bzhin no zhes pa bsten pa'o //
translated: The aspect is the nature.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: This is the literal meaning.

original: tshig gi skabs 'byed pa ni 'chad bzhin pa'i tshig gi skabs so //
analyzed: tshig gi skabs 'byed pa ni 'chad bzhin pa'i tshig gi skabs so //
translated: The context is the context of the words being explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /🔽gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa / gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: sems gtso bas na 'di'i sems su brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems gtso bas na 'di'i sems su brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because of the primacy of mind, it should be called mind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /🔽rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa / rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste de nyid rigs so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste de nyid rigs so //
translated: The vajra is Mahāvajradhara, and that is the family.

original: de gtso bo'i phyir dam pa'o //
analyzed: de gtso bo'i phyir dam pa'o //
translated: Because of its primacy, it is supreme.

original: mi bskyod pa ni de dang gnyis su med par gyur pas gnas skabs las gtso bo nyid do //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa ni de dang gnyis su med par gyur pas gnas skabs las gtso bo nyid do //
translated: Akshobhya is the primary one because of being non-dual with that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rlung gi de nyid du 'ang dkyil 'khor bzhi la yi ge gsum gtso bor gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rlung gi de nyid du 'ang dkyil 'khor bzhi la yi ge gsum gtso bor gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in the reality of wind, the three syllables are said to be primary in the four maṇḍalas.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa chu la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams ni chu'i dkyil 'khor nyid 'di yang rdo rje mgon po 'dir lha'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i bdag nyid can du gsungs so //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa chu la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams ni chu'i dkyil 'khor nyid 'di yang rdo rje mgon po 'dir lha'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i bdag nyid can du gsungs so //
translated: The maṇḍalas of water, etc., of Akṣobhya, etc., are said to be of the nature of that [vajra] by this [verse] beginning with “This is the lord of the vajra maṇḍala of water, etc.”

original: g-yo bar mi nus pas na zhes pa ni rten dang brten par bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor ni /
analyzed: g-yo bar mi nus pas na zhes pa ni rten dang brten par bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor ni /
translated: “Because it cannot be moved” means that the maṇḍala with its support and supported

original: de la mtshan ma dang bya bas kyang 'gal bar bya bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mtshan ma dang bya bas kyang 'gal bar bya bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: cannot be contradicted even by signs and actions.

original: sku zhes pa la sogs pas don dam pa'i bden pa'i ba den pa'i rang bzhin nyid rten gyi dkyil 'khor du mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: sku zhes pa la sogs pas don dam pa'i bden pa'i ba den pa'i rang bzhin nyid rten gyi dkyil 'khor du mngon par brjod do //
translated: By “body” and so on, the ultimate truth is expressed as the maṇḍala of the support, which is of the nature of the ultimate truth.

original: gzhan mi 'thad pa'i rigs pas dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i thig bskul ba'i cho ga nyid kyang gzhan ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan mi 'thad pa'i rigs pas dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i thig bskul ba'i cho ga nyid kyang gzhan ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: It is taught that the procedure of drawing the maṇḍala, etc., with lines is not otherwise, by reasoning that is not otherwise.

original: tshad dang ldan pa zhes pa'i gsung las thig skud gzhan gyis khru la sogs pa'i tshad kyi dbyu gu phra mo la sogs pas dkyil 'khor bri bar byed pa ni gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la dgongs pas dmyal ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tshad dang ldan pa zhes pa'i gsung las thig skud gzhan gyis khru la sogs pa'i tshad kyi dbyu gu phra mo la sogs pas dkyil 'khor bri bar byed pa ni gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la dgongs pas dmyal ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir //
translated: From the statement with the proper measurements, the drawing of the maṇḍala with a thread of another measure, such as a cubit, is a cause of hell, because it is a transgression of the Tathāgata's word.

original: sgo'i nyi shu cha'i tshad la ltos nas ha cang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgo'i nyi shu cha'i tshad la ltos nas ha cang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: With reference to the measure of one-twentieth of the door, it is said too small, etc.

original: sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje rnams yang dag par gzhag pa ste lha la dmigs pas dkyil 'khor bya ba nyid do ;
analyzed: sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sku la sogs pa'i rdo rje rnams yang dag par gzhag pa ste lha la dmigs pas dkyil 'khor bya ba nyid do ;
translated: The maṇḍala is to be made by visualizing the deities, with the proper arrangement of the vajras of the body, etc.

original: / rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor rjes su dran zhing sems dpa' rnams kyi rim pas thig gdab po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: / rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor rjes su dran zhing sems dpa' rnams kyi rim pas thig gdab po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Remembering the yoga of one's chosen deity, one should lay out the lines in the sequence of the sattvas.

original: gcig gnyis zhes pa ni snying po'i dbus nas rgya khyon te /
analyzed: gcig gnyis zhes pa ni snying po'i dbus nas rgya khyon te /
translated: One, two, etc. refers to the area from the center of the essence.

original: ngos re rer khru drug yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngos re rer khru drug yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since each side is six cubits, it is said one, two, etc.

original: phyi rol zhes pa ni rten gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: phyi rol zhes pa ni rten gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The external is the supporting mandala.

original: de nas gru bzhi pa @75b la sogs pa sngar gsungs pa'i khyad par gyi nus pa las so //
analyzed: de nas gru bzhi pa @75b la sogs pa sngar gsungs pa'i khyad par gyi nus pa las so //
translated: Then, the square and so forth are distinguished by the power of the previously stated distinctions.

original: gang nang gi dkyil 'khor ni gru bzhin pa la sogs pa nyid kyis rnam par phye ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang nang gi dkyil 'khor ni gru bzhin pa la sogs pa nyid kyis rnam par phye ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, Is the inner mandala not distinguished by being square and so forth?

original: de ni zlum po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni zlum po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is round.

original: rim pa gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i dkyil 'khor dag grub bzhi pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: rim pa gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i dkyil 'khor dag grub bzhi pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Since the second and third mandalas are square, it is said:

original: kun nas yongs su zlum po'i rnam par zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas yongs su zlum po'i rnam par zhes pa'o //
translated: The form is completely round.

original: phyag rgya dgod pa de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbrel lo //
analyzed: phyag rgya dgod pa de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbrel lo //
translated: The placement of the seals is stated from then and so forth. The phrase and so forth connects with what is to be explained.

original: chog zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi'i dkyil 'khor dang 'brel ba nyid kyi phyir thog mar bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: chog zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi'i dkyil 'khor dang 'brel ba nyid kyi phyir thog mar bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Since the external mandala is connected with the statement beginning with the site, and so forth, it is explained first.

original: cho ga nyi shu zhes pa ni klu'i b'o'i zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho gar gsungs pa'i sa sbyangs pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: cho ga nyi shu zhes pa ni klu'i b'o'i zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho gar gsungs pa'i sa sbyangs pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The twenty rites are those taught in the mandala rite composed by Nagarjuna's disciple, such as the purification of the site.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes pa ni //🔽gnas ni bskyed pa sngon 'gro bas //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes pa ni // gnas ni bskyed pa sngon 'gro bas //
translated: After that means🔽after the rite of the site.

original: rdo rje gsum ni bskyed par bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir mtshan mar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni bskyed par bya // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir mtshan mar bya'o //
translated: The place is generated, preceded by the generation of the three vajras.

original: shes par bya'o //
analyzed: shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the sign is to be known, and it is to be generated.

original: bskyed par bya'o zhes pa 'di'i phyir mtshan ma de nyid phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: bskyed par bya'o zhes pa 'di'i phyir mtshan ma de nyid phyag rgya'o //
translated: Therefore, that sign is the seal.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa'i brda'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa'i brda'o //
translated: The sign of the aspect of the Tathagata is the great seal.

original: chos rnams ston par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi brda ni chos kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams ston par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi brda ni chos kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The sign of the characteristic of teaching the dharmas is the dharma seal.

original: phyag rgya gnyis la ltes nas chen po yang de yin phyag rgya yang yin no zhes pas phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya gnyis la ltes nas chen po yang de yin phyag rgya yang yin no zhes pas phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: Having seen the two seals, it is great and it is a seal, thus it is the great seal.

original: lha rnams nyid phyag rgya bzhi'i bdag nyid can yin pa nyid ma yin nam phag rgya rnam pa gsum ni lha so sor re re'i gcig nyid kyi gzugs su sgom pa'i phyir ci ltar 'di dag rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du slar yang de dag ci ltar 'gyur
analyzed: lha rnams nyid phyag rgya bzhi'i bdag nyid can yin pa nyid ma yin nam phag rgya rnam pa gsum ni lha so sor re re'i gcig nyid kyi gzugs su sgom pa'i phyir ci ltar 'di dag rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du slar yang de dag ci ltar 'gyur
translated: Are not the deities themselves the nature of the four seals?  Since the three seals are meditated as the form of each individual deity, how can they be again in the mandala of colored powder?

original: zhes bsam par mi bya ste dkyil 'khor sgrub pa la sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la phyag rgya rnam pa gsum gyi rgyas gdab par mi nus par mngon par 'dod pas so sor sems kyi rgyud gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bsam par mi bya ste dkyil 'khor sgrub pa la sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la phyag rgya rnam pa gsum gyi rgyas gdab par mi nus par mngon par 'dod pas so sor sems kyi rgyud gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Do not think in this way, because it is asserted that in the accomplishment of the mandala, the three seals cannot be impressed on the mindstreams of all sentient beings, since they each have a different mindstream.

original: yang na sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa'i rigs can nyid do //🔽sogs pa'i sgra las nus pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: yang na sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa'i rigs can nyid do // sogs pa'i sgra las nus pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: Or, the mindstreams of all sentient beings are of the family of Mohavajra and so on.

original: ltos nas zhes pa ni //
analyzed: ltos nas zhes pa ni //
translated: The word “and so on” includes the families of Divya and so on.🔽“

original: de la sems can thams cad gang gi rigs yin pa de'i rigs kyi bdag po nyid dang mthun pa'i phyag rgya dgod par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la sems can thams cad gang gi rigs yin pa de'i rigs kyi bdag po nyid dang mthun pa'i phyag rgya dgod par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should set out the seal that is in accord with the nature of the lord of the family of whatever family all sentient beings belong to.

original: de la nye bar mtshon pa'i don du zhes pa ni //🔽phyag rgya chen po dang chos kyi phyag rgya dag dgod pa'i rim @76a * //
analyzed: de la nye bar mtshon pa'i don du zhes pa ni // phyag rgya chen po dang chos kyi phyag rgya dag dgod pa'i rim @76a * //
translated: As for the meaning of “indicating,”

original: pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: it is for the purpose of understanding the process of setting out the great seal and the doctrine seal.

original: de'i zhes pa ni snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa ni snying po'i dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
translated: “That” refers to the essence maṇḍala.

original: sems can 'jigs pa'i rgyu las 'jigs pa skyed par byed pa po yang ngo //
analyzed: sems can 'jigs pa'i rgyu las 'jigs pa skyed par byed pa po yang ngo //
translated: It is also the one who generates fear from the cause of fear of sentient beings.

original: rdo rje zhes pa ni gtso bo'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa ni gtso bo'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: “Vajra” is the sign of the principal.

original: reg bya rdo rje ma'i mtshan ma la reg bya rdo rje ma'i mtshan ma dgod pa 'dir ma gsungs pa ni gtso bo'i mtshan ma dgod pa la ltos pas thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / btsun mo dam pa yin pa nyid kyis lhan cig spyod pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: reg bya rdo rje ma'i mtshan ma la reg bya rdo rje ma'i mtshan ma dgod pa 'dir ma gsungs pa ni gtso bo'i mtshan ma dgod pa la ltos pas thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / btsun mo dam pa yin pa nyid kyis lhan cig spyod pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The setting out of the sign of the tactile vajrī on the sign of the tactile vajrī is not mentioned here because it is obtained by relying on the setting out of the sign of the principal and because of the simultaneity of the excellent queen.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams 'od zer zhes pa dkar po la sogs pa rnams so//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams 'od zer zhes pa dkar po la sogs pa rnams so//
translated: The Tathagatas Vairocana and so on are the white light rays and so on.

original: 'khor lo zhes pa ni rtsibs brgyad pa dkar po'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes pa ni rtsibs brgyad pa dkar po'o //
translated: The wheel is white and has eight spokes.

original: 'od zer gyi tshogs ni ser po la sogs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi phung po'o //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi tshogs ni ser po la sogs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi phung po'o //
translated: The mass of light rays is the aggregate of the five lights, yellow and so on.

original: rin chen zhes pa ni ser po cha dgu pa'o //🔽chen po nyid ces pa ni yang dag ji ltar so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can nyid kyis padma ni chen po nyid yin pa de bzhin du me long dang mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'khor lo dang rin
analyzed: rin chen zhes pa ni ser po cha dgu pa'o // chen po nyid ces pa ni yang dag ji ltar so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can nyid kyis padma ni chen po nyid yin pa de bzhin du me long dang mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'khor lo dang rin
translated: The jewel is yellow and has nine parts.

original: po che la sogs pa rnams kyang chen po nyid du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: po che la sogs pa rnams kyang chen po nyid du bsam par bya'o //
translated: Since the great lotus is the nature of the gnosis that individually discriminates reality just as it is, the wheel, jewel, and so on are also considered to be great because they are the nature of the mirrorlike and so on.

original: padma r'a ga ni rin po che chen po'i bye brag kha dog dmar po'o //
analyzed: padma r'a ga ni rin po che chen po'i bye brag kha dog dmar po'o //
translated: The padmaraga is a red variety of great jewel.

original: dmar po 'bar ba la sogs pa 'od zer lnga 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: dmar po 'bar ba la sogs pa 'od zer lnga 'bar ba'o //
translated: The blazing red and so on are the blazing of the five lights.

original: 'od 'phro ba ni 'od zer lnga'i gtsug phung rab tu gsal ba'am /
analyzed: 'od 'phro ba ni 'od zer lnga'i gtsug phung rab tu gsal ba'am /
translated: The shining is the shining forth of the mass of five lights.

original: zla ba'i phyi rol du spros pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i phyi rol du spros pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: Or, the shining is the appearance of the emanation outside of the moon.

original: spyan zhes pa ni spyan zung ngo //
analyzed: spyan zhes pa ni spyan zung ngo //
translated: The eyes are the two eyes.

original: 'khor lo yang dkar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo yang dkar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The wheel also has the five lights, white and so on.

original: rdo rde'i rigs zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: rdo rde'i rigs zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'i rigs so //
translated: The vajra family is the Akṣhobhya family.

original: ltos pa zhes pa ni rdo rje la rag las pa zhes mngon par dgongs so //
analyzed: ltos pa zhes pa ni rdo rje la rag las pa zhes mngon par dgongs so //
translated: The dependence is the vajra, as is the intention.

original: rtsa bar bcas zhes pa la sogs pas gos dkar mo la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: rtsa bar bcas zhes pa la sogs pas gos dkar mo la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mngon par brjod do //
translated: The root and so on indicate the signs of Pāṇḍaravāsinī and so on.

original: sngon po zhes pa la sogs pas sgrol ma'i'o //
analyzed: sngon po zhes pa la sogs pas sgrol ma'i'o //
translated: The blue and so on indicate Tārā.

original: lnga zhes pa la sogs pa tho ba dang sbrel lo //
analyzed: lnga zhes pa la sogs pa tho ba dang sbrel lo //
translated: The five and so on connect with the hammer.

original: sngon po zhes pa la sogs pa rgyu nyid du mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po zhes pa la sogs pa rgyu nyid du mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The blue and so on are expressed as the cause.

original: rdo rje bzhin du thogs pa med pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i 'od zer lnga 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzhin du thogs pa med pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i 'od zer lnga 'bar ba'o //
translated: The five lights, blue and so on, blaze forth without obstruction like a vajra.

original: de pas na 'od bzang ba ste mchog tu gyur pa'i 'od do //
analyzed: de pas na 'od bzang ba ste mchog tu gyur pa'i 'od do //
translated: Therefore, it is the good light, the supreme light.

original: ral gri bzhin du rno bas bgegs gcod par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ral gri bzhin du rno bas bgegs gcod par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is sharp like a sword, because it cuts off the obstacles.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje zhes pa'i @76b mthar thug pas mtshan ma gcig gsum mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje zhes pa'i @76b mthar thug pas mtshan ma gcig gsum mngon par brjod do //
translated: The vajra cross is the ultimate, and is expressed by the single syllable HŪṀ.

original: rgya cher zhes pa la sogs pas dgod pa gzhan la ltos pa'i 'brel pa bstan te /
analyzed: rgya cher zhes pa la sogs pas dgod pa gzhan la ltos pa'i 'brel pa bstan te /
translated: The word extensive and so on teaches the connection that depends on another arrangement.

original: de yang klu'i blos mdzad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga la'o //
analyzed: de yang klu'i blos mdzad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga la'o //
translated: And that is in the mandala ritual composed by Nāgabodhi.

original: lus la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgra las dag dang sems dag gzung ngo //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgra las dag dang sems dag gzung ngo //
translated: The word body and so on includes the mind.

original: de la bza' ba gang gis lus dang ngag tshim par bya ba ni mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de la bza' ba gang gis lus dang ngag tshim par bya ba ni mchod pa'o //
translated: There, the offering that satisfies the body and speech with food is the offering.

original: nang gi bdag nyid can zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchog tu gyur pa'i sems kyi mchod pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid can zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchog tu gyur pa'i sems kyi mchod pa ston par byed do //
translated: With the inner nature and so on, he teaches the supreme mental offering.

original: na tshod gzhon pa la shin tu dga' ba dang sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i phyir dang khu ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na tshod gzhon pa la shin tu dga' ba dang sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i phyir dang khu ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because suffering arises for one who is very fond of youth, and because semen is not emitted.

original: na tshod rgan pa la yang rnam pa de bzhin du reg pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir bcu drug ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: na tshod rgan pa la yang rnam pa de bzhin du reg pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir bcu drug ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And because the object of touch does not exist in that way for one who is old, it is said “sixteen,” and so on.

original: rang gi rigs kyi yan lag ces pa ni rigs gzhan bsgoms pas dngos grub par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi yan lag ces pa ni rigs gzhan bsgoms pas dngos grub par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “One’s own family limb” means that one does not attain power by cultivating another family, because it is said in another tantra.

original: bu mo zhes pa la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang mchod pa bya bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: bu mo zhes pa la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang mchod pa bya bar ston par byed do //
translated: “Girl,” and so on, teaches that one should worship with form, and so on.

original: de'i dbus su zhes pa ni nye ba'i dbang du byas nas bdun pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus su zhes pa ni nye ba'i dbang du byas nas bdun pa ste /
translated: “In its middle” is the seventh, from the point of view of proximity.

original: de bas na bris pa'i rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor de'i drung du re lde dang gos la sogs pa la skye bo dang bral bar byas pa dang bris pa'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su yang 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bris pa'i rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor de'i drung du re lde dang gos la sogs pa la skye bo dang bral bar byas pa dang bris pa'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su yang 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in front of the drawn sand mandala, one should imagine the assembly mandala, which is like the drawn mandala, devoid of people, such as the fence and the cloth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad tshim par bya'o zhes pa ni tshim ba bskyed nas byin gyis brlabs nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de la rol par byed pa'i rim pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad tshim par bya'o zhes pa ni tshim ba bskyed nas byin gyis brlabs nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de la rol par byed pa'i rim pa gsungs pa /
translated: One should satisfy all the Tathagatas means that, having generated satisfaction, having consecrated, and so on, the process of enjoying that is stated:

original: yon tan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The qualities, and so on.

original: de ni ring min thung ba min //
analyzed: de ni ring min thung ba min //
translated: It is neither long nor short,

original: sbom pa ma yin phra ba min //
analyzed: sbom pa ma yin phra ba min //
translated: neither gross nor subtle,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa m'a ma k'i'i yon tan rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa m'a ma k'i'i yon tan rnams kyi'o //
translated: and so on, are the qualities of Mamaki.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is stated:

original: dngos su zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos su zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In reality, and so on.

original: de nas zhes pa ni rang bzhin nyams su myong ba'i mchod pa de ma thag par ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni rang bzhin nyams su myong ba'i mchod pa de ma thag par ro //
translated: Thereupon means immediately after the offering of the experience of the nature.

original: phyi rol du bya'o zhes pa ni sangs rgyas lnga'i bdag nyid can du bsams nas so //
analyzed: phyi rol du bya'o zhes pa ni sangs rgyas lnga'i bdag nyid can du bsams nas so //
translated: The phrase externally means that one should imagine the five buddhas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: ci ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: How is it that the five nectars are to be enjoyed?

original: nam mkha'i zhes pa la sogs pa ni nam mkha' ni lha mo'i mkha'o /
analyzed: nam mkha'i zhes pa la sogs pa ni nam mkha' ni lha mo'i mkha'o /
translated: The phrase in the sky and so forth means that the sky is the space of the goddess,

original: dbyings ni bu ga mdzes par byed pa'o //🔽'di'i @77a * //
analyzed: dbyings ni bu ga mdzes par byed pa'o // 'di'i @77a * //
translated: and the realm is the beautiful hole.

original: don gsungs pa /
analyzed: don gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of this is stated:

original: byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The bodhicitta and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The array of the tathāgatas is the maṇḍala wheel.

original: byang chub kyi sems tsam gyis ni kun rdzob pa yis so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems tsam gyis ni kun rdzob pa yis so //
translated: By the mere bodhicitta is by the conventional [truth].

original: mchod pa bya ba zhes pa bdud rtsi myong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa bya ba zhes pa bdud rtsi myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: One should make offerings means one should experience the nectar.

original: de'i lhag mas lha'i 'khor lo bskyed pa 'gro ba'i don du bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lhag mas lha'i 'khor lo bskyed pa 'gro ba'i don du bya'o //
translated: With the remainder of that, one should generate the deity wheel for the benefit of migrating beings.

original: lnga zhes pa ni bshad ba dang gci pa dang khrag dang khu ba dang rkang mar zhes bya ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: lnga zhes pa ni bshad ba dang gci pa dang khrag dang khu ba dang rkang mar zhes bya ba rnams kyis so //
translated: Five refers to feces, urine, blood, semen, and marrow.

original: ts'a ru ni sngags la sogs pas bsgrubs pa'i lha rnams kyis bza' ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ts'a ru ni sngags la sogs pas bsgrubs pa'i lha rnams kyis bza' ba lta bu'o //
translated: The causal is like the food of the gods accomplished by means of mantras, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gi rang bzhin gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gi rang bzhin gnas pa'o //
translated: The wheel of the maṇḍala is the external and internal nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: By that very thing, etc.

original: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The buddhas are Vairocana, etc.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams so //
translated: The aggregates of form, etc., being of the nature of that, are the aggregates of form, etc.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the bodhisattvas are Kṣitigarbha, etc.

original: snga ma bzhin du sa la sogs pa'i khams rgyas pa las byung ba las gyur pa rnams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sa la sogs pa'i khams rgyas pa las byung ba las gyur pa rnams rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The elements of earth, etc., being of the nature of that, are the elements of earth, etc.

original: spyod pa bzang ba ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa bzang ba ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: The good conduct is pleasing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The world, etc.

original: drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: drang ba'i don to //
translated: This is the interpretable meaning.

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The “mandala of mind” is the mandala of mind.

original: rdo rje ye shes ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ye shes ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Vajra wisdom is ultimate truth.

original: rab 'dra ba ni de dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'dra ba ni de dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The “best” is that which is similar to it.

original: sku la sogs pa gcig pa nyid kyis sems dpa' yin pa'i phyir sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa gcig pa nyid kyis sems dpa' yin pa'i phyir sku zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Since it is a hero because of being the sameness of body, etc., he says “body,” etc.

original: phung po dang khams rnams kyi grangs dgu ste de tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po dang khams rnams kyi grangs dgu ste de tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The aggregates and constituents are nine in number, and since that is all there is,

original: dgu'i bdag nyid mchog ni sgra ji bzhin par bstan pa'i rnam pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: dgu'i bdag nyid mchog ni sgra ji bzhin par bstan pa'i rnam pa la ltos nas so //
translated: the “best of the nine” is taught literally.

original: legs bsgril ni bden pa gnyis po dag go //
analyzed: legs bsgril ni bden pa gnyis po dag go //
translated: “Well-rolled” is the two truths.

original: sna tshogs ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: “Various” is of various aspects.

original: des lung du rab tu bstan pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: des lung du rab tu bstan pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since it is well-taught by scripture,

original: sna tshogs lung gis brdar gyur pa ni sna tshogs pa'i lung nyid kyis kyang brdar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs lung gis brdar gyur pa ni sna tshogs pa'i lung nyid kyis kyang brdar gyur pa ste /
translated: “various scriptures” are also well-taught by the various scriptures.

original: gzhung du smos pa la yang 'dus pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhung du smos pa la yang 'dus pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is designated in the text as the Saṃgīti, etc.,

original: tshad ma bzang po ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma bzang po ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The good measure is the nature of ultimate truth.

original: kun rdzob ces pa la sogs pa ni gang @77b gi phyir bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can yin pa de'i phyir gnyis su med pa gdod ma'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob ces pa la sogs pa ni gang @77b gi phyir bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can yin pa de'i phyir gnyis su med pa gdod ma'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The word relative and so on means that because it has the nature of the two truths, therefore it is the primordial nature of non-duality.

original: thig gi sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: thig gi sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: The application of the line is stated:

original: shes rab ces pa la sogs pa ste shes rab ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ces pa la sogs pa ste shes rab ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Wisdom and so on. Wisdom is ultimate truth.

original: thabs ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Means is relative truth.

original: 'di shes rab la rab tu zhugs pas shes rab dang thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'di shes rab la rab tu zhugs pas shes rab dang thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: This is the nature of wisdom and means, which are engaged in wisdom.

original: chos zhes pa ni chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir shes rab po //
analyzed: chos zhes pa ni chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir shes rab po //
translated: Dharma is wisdom because it has the nature of the dharmakāya.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa zhes pa ni snga ma gnyis po rtogs pa 'di dag mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa zhes pa ni snga ma gnyis po rtogs pa 'di dag mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment is the expression of these two realizations.

original: da ni mchog ni yongs su dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni mchog ni yongs su dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Now, the supreme is because of complete purity.

original: thig gdab bya zhes pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thig gdab bya zhes pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The line to be drawn is the teaching.

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni sngar rab tu bstan pa dang don mtshungs so //
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni sngar rab tu bstan pa dang don mtshungs so //
translated: The so-called “mind mandala” is similar in meaning to what was previously taught.

original: gang yang rim pa 'dis bshad pa 'di la thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi thig btab pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang rim pa 'dis bshad pa 'di la thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi thig btab pa'o //
translated: And this explanation by way of the stages is the “mind mandala dot.”

original: rten cing zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rten cing zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: “Dependent” is stated

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pas so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pas so //
translated: by way of dependent origination.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis te /
translated: The “twelve limbs” are the twelve limbs such as ignorance,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pas 'gro ba'i rgyud la grub pa'i don te gzhon nu bzhin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pas 'gro ba'i rgyud la grub pa'i don te gzhon nu bzhin no //
translated: which are the meaning established in the continuum of migrating beings by way of dependent origination, like a youth.

original: ji ltar slar yang 'jig rten na grags pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung be'i yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di bsdus pa'i phyir de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar slar yang 'jig rten na grags pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung be'i yan lag bcu gnyis po 'di bsdus pa'i phyir de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is well known in the world, these twelve limbs of dependent origination should be stated in the same way in order to include them.

original: gang gi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Why is it stated?

original: 'jigs pa dang ni bskyed pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang ni bskyed pa'i rgyu //
translated: It is the cause of generating fear.

original: tshig don brgyad du shes par bya //
analyzed: tshig don brgyad du shes par bya //
translated: It should be known as the eight topics.

original: zhes so // 'od gsal las kyang stong pa che //
analyzed: zhes so // 'od gsal las kyang stong pa che //
translated: From clear light, great emptiness.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa bsam par bya ste /
translated: One should contemplate in this way and so forth.

original: gang yang yan lag bcu gnyis nyid tshig don brgyad kyi nang du rtogs pa 'di mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: gang yang yan lag bcu gnyis nyid tshig don brgyad kyi nang du rtogs pa 'di mi 'gal lo //
translated: Also, the twelve branches are realized within the eight topics. This is not contradictory.

original: grub bzhi pa la sogs pa yang sbyar ba'i phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ru gsungs pa /
analyzed: grub bzhi pa la sogs pa yang sbyar ba'i phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ru gsungs pa /
translated: The Enjoyment Body is taught to be the four sides and so forth because it is applied.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The four noble truths and so forth are as follows.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The four noble truths are the four noble truths.

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: They are the essence of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: gang gi phyir mi mnyam pa med pa de'i phyir ngos bzhi pa'o //🔽kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis yang dag par bsdus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di rnams gnyis po de dag gnyis su med pa nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan @78a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi mnyam pa med pa de'i phyir ngos bzhi pa'o // kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis yang dag par bsdus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di rnams gnyis po de dag gnyis su med pa nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan @78a * //
translated: Because there is no inequality, therefore it is the four sides.🔽Because the two truths, the conventional and the ultimate, are completely included, these two are nondual.

original: 'das so // mi mnyam pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: 'das so // mi mnyam pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān is without inequality, that is, without arising and ceasing.

original: yongs su shes pa ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: Complete knowledge is the result.

original: 'dir bden pa gnyis po bde ba'i bdag nyid can nam yin nam ci ltar sdug bsngal la sogs ba'i bden pa bzhi po de dag bden pa gnyis kyi nang du gtogs zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir bden pa gnyis po bde ba'i bdag nyid can nam yin nam ci ltar sdug bsngal la sogs ba'i bden pa bzhi po de dag bden pa gnyis kyi nang du gtogs zhe na /
translated: Here, one may say: Are the two truths of the nature of happiness or how are the four truths of suffering, etc. included in the two truths?

original: bden te 'on kyang 'di dag nyan thos la sogs pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rigs can rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi bde ba yin yang phung po la sogs par mchog tu shes pa'i don du sdug bsngal la sogs pa nyid du mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang 'di dag nyan thos la sogs pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rigs can rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi bde ba yin yang phung po la sogs par mchog tu shes pa'i don du sdug bsngal la sogs pa nyid du mngon par brjod do //
translated: It is true, but these are the natural happiness of those of the lineage free from attachment, such as the Sravakas, etc. , but they are expressed as suffering, etc. , in order to understand the aggregates, etc. as supreme.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir sprul pa yang ngos bzhi la sogs pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir sprul pa yang ngos bzhi la sogs pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: Also the emanation is explained as having four sides, etc. , because it is the cause of the perfect enjoyment.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i rim pas /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i rim pas /
translated: By the order of arrangement,

original: tshangs pa'i thig nas yang dag brtsam //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i thig nas yang dag brtsam //
translated: one should begin with the line of Brahma,

original: grub bzhi pa yi ngo po nyid //
analyzed: grub bzhi pa yi ngo po nyid //
translated: the nature of four sides,

original: khang pa brtsegs pa ltar snang ba //
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa ltar snang ba //
translated: appearing like a multi-storied house.

original: rnal 'byor pa yi sku'i dkyil 'khor //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yi sku'i dkyil 'khor //
translated: This is the mandala of the body of the yogi.

original: zhes so // tshangs pa zhes pa ni byams pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i 'jig rten bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // tshangs pa zhes pa ni byams pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i 'jig rten bskyed pa'o //
translated: Brahma is the creator of the Brahma world, because it is the result of the object of meditation on loving-kindness, etc.

original: de'i phyir byams pa la sogs pa ni tshangs pa rnams kyi gnas te gnas nyid gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byams pa la sogs pa ni tshangs pa rnams kyi gnas te gnas nyid gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, loving-kindness, etc. are the abode of the Brahmas, and the abode itself is the abode.

original: bzhi po de dag gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gra bzhi'o //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gra bzhi'o //
translated: The four corners are the four directions, because they are the nature of those four.

original: sgo zhes pa ni sgo bzhi'o //
analyzed: sgo zhes pa ni sgo bzhi'o //
translated: The four gates are the four entrances.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos grags ni sems can rnams 'dir bsdu bar bya'o /🔽zhes rnam par grags bzhin pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid khang pa brtsegs pa la'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos grags ni sems can rnams 'dir bsdu bar bya'o / zhes rnam par grags bzhin pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid khang pa brtsegs pa la'o //
translated: The four means of gathering are the four means of gathering students, because sentient beings are gathered here.

original: sbyin pa dang tshig snyan pa dang don spyod pa dang don mthun pa'i dngos po bzhi po 'di rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshig snyan pa dang don spyod pa dang don mthun pa'i dngos po bzhi po 'di rnams kyis so //
translated: The four means of gathering are fame, generosity, accomplishing the aims of sentient beings, and being consistent with what one preaches.🔽The four means of gathering are fame, generosity, accomplishing the aims of sentient beings, and being consistent with what one preaches.

original: gnas par byed pa'i don bya bar gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes pas de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi sku nyid sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa'i don bya bar gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes pas de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi sku nyid sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod par bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One’s body itself is the door, etc., because it is the very nature of the four kinds of conversion and the four doors.

original: re re zhes pa ni bsdu ba bzhi po rnams dang sgo bzhi po rnams dang re re ste so so re re la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du ming can gnyis po dag gi ming gi byed pa'o //
analyzed: re re zhes pa ni bsdu ba bzhi po rnams dang sgo bzhi po rnams dang re re ste so so re re la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du ming can gnyis po dag gi ming gi byed pa'o //
translated: “Each” refers to the four kinds of conversion and the four doors, each one by one, and the function of the names of the two sets of four is in accordance with the number.

original: chos dbyings ni de bzhin nyid de //
analyzed: chos dbyings ni de bzhin nyid de //
translated: The Dharma realm is thusness.

original: de'i don du bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don du bya'o //
translated: It is to be made into that.

original: bstan bar bya'o zhes pa de chos kyi dbyings kyi don gyi brda ste 'khor lo'i rnam pa nang gi dkyil 'khor ni 'khor lo'i nang gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: bstan bar bya'o zhes pa de chos kyi dbyings kyi don gyi brda ste 'khor lo'i rnam pa nang gi dkyil 'khor ni 'khor lo'i nang gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: It is to be taught. That is the symbolic name of the Dharma realm. The inner maṇḍala in the form of a wheel is the maṇḍala in the wheel.

original: mi phyed pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: Non-dual means cause and effect are non-dual.

original: ye shes ni @78b gnyug ma'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir des shes pa de'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni @78b gnyug ma'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir des shes pa de'o //
translated: Wisdom is the intrinsic nature, and that which is known by that is wisdom.

original: de nyid mtshan mas te dbye bar bya ba ma yin pas rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid mtshan mas te dbye bar bya ba ma yin pas rdo rje'o //
translated: That is the vajra because it is not to be differentiated by characteristics.

original: aindra na'i la zhes pa ni rin po che aindra na'i la'i kha dog ste /
analyzed: aindra na'i la zhes pa ni rin po che aindra na'i la'i kha dog ste /
translated: Indranīla is the color of the indranīla jewel.

original: mi bskyod pa'i gzugs su 'byin pa dang rab tu 'jug pa ni ye shes kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i gzugs su 'byin pa dang rab tu 'jug pa ni ye shes kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emergence and entry of Akṣobhya’s form is the nature of the gnosis body.

original: phyag rgya ni mtshan ma'i phyag rgya'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya ni mtshan ma'i phyag rgya'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The seal is the nature of the seal of the sign.

original: rnam pa lnga ru ste bshad pa'i rtse mo grangs lnga bo dbus ma'i rtse mo gnyis ka'i ngos so so'i grangs la ltos pa med par rtse mo de'i chos can gyis 'khor 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ru ste bshad pa'i rtse mo grangs lnga bo dbus ma'i rtse mo gnyis ka'i ngos so so'i grangs la ltos pa med par rtse mo de'i chos can gyis 'khor 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: In five ways, the five-counted peak of the explanation, the two peaks of the center, each counted side, without regard to the number of that peak, the subject of that peak, is destroyed.

original: shar zhes pa la sogs pas shar te thog ma ru me long ste gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pas nye bar dmigs bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid mngon par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: shar zhes pa la sogs pas shar te thog ma ru me long ste gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pas nye bar dmigs bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid mngon par brjod par bya'o //
translated: “East” and so on. First, the mirror, because of the appearance of the reflection, is to be observed. That is to be expressed.

original: rin chen la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du drug pa sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: rin chen la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du drug pa sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, the six should be applied to the jewels, etc.

original: mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i ye shes ni de'i phung po'i ldog pas gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i ye shes ni de'i phung po'i ldog pas gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of sameness, etc. is the very abode of the body of that knowledge.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa kun nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa kun nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said: “all around” and so forth.

original: byams pa la sogs pa yang de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa yang de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Also, love, etc. is said to be the very nature of that knowledge.

original: shar lhor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shar lhor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “In the southeast” and so forth.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyang de'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir gsungs pa ;
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyang de'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir gsungs pa ;
translated: The means of gathering, such as generosity, etc. are also said to be the very nature of that knowledge.

original: sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Generosity” and so forth.

original: ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i rnam par ye shes kyi sku mchog tu 'dzin no //
analyzed: ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i rnam par ye shes kyi sku mchog tu 'dzin no //
translated: “Just as” means that the knowledge body is apprehended as supreme.

original: yang dag gnas pa ni de la ma nor bar dmigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag gnas pa ni de la ma nor bar dmigs par byed pa'o //
translated: “Correct placement” is the non-erroneous observation of that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa la sogs pa bde ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di'i dmigs pa'o zhes mchod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa la sogs pa bde ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di'i dmigs pa'o zhes mchod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Since the infinite tathāgatas, etc. are the nature of bliss, they are the object of this [great seal]. Thus, they are worshipped.

original: slar yang dmigs pa 'di ci ltar 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang dmigs pa 'di ci ltar 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Again, how is this object? It is said:

original: rnam gsum bsgoms pa ste rna ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum bsgom pa rnams kyis zhes mang po'i tshig ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang / de las ldang ba la dmigs pa dag nye bar mtshon pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam gsum bsgoms pa ste rna ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum bsgom pa rnams kyis zhes mang po'i tshig ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang / de las ldang ba la dmigs pa dag nye bar mtshon pa'i don to //
translated: By cultivating the three aspects, that is, by cultivating the three aspects of the ear, etc. The plural particle indicates the object of suchness and the object of rising from that.

original: chen po nyid ces pa na 'chad bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: chen po nyid ces pa na 'chad bzhin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of greatness is as explained.

original: dang por zhes pa ni 'di la dang po nyid du ldan pa'i phyag rgyar so sor ston par byed de 'di dag ces dang por bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'o //
analyzed: dang por zhes pa ni 'di la dang po nyid du ldan pa'i phyag rgyar so sor ston par byed de 'di dag ces dang por bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'o //
translated: First means that this is taught as the first mudrā. These refers to the body of the Blessed One.

original: phyag rgya zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The mudrā is the wisdom body.

original: @79a * // dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po nyid dkyil 'khor du mngon par brjod par bya'o zhes yang dag par brjod pa'i don to //
analyzed: @79a * // dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po nyid dkyil 'khor du mngon par brjod par bya'o zhes yang dag par brjod pa'i don to //
translated: The term “maṇḍala” should be expressed as the maṇḍala of the great seal.

original: skad cig ces pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig ces pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: The term “moment” and so on

original: rnam pa sna tshogs dang rnam par smin pa dang mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs dang rnam par smin pa dang mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: is free from the various aspects, the ripened, and characteristics.

original: sogs pa la sogs pa'i sgra las dga' ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: sogs pa la sogs pa'i sgra las dga' ba bzhi'o //
translated: The term “and so on” refers to the four joys.

original: 'di dag re re la bzhi bzhi'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag re re la bzhi bzhi'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because each of these has the nature of four.

original: ming du 'gyur zhes pa ni phyogs gcig rgyud gzhan dang nyan theg par yang lam skad cig bcu drug tu bstan to //
analyzed: ming du 'gyur zhes pa ni phyogs gcig rgyud gzhan dang nyan theg par yang lam skad cig bcu drug tu bstan to //
translated: The term “name” is one part. In other tantras and in the vehicle of the hearers, the path is taught as sixteen moments.

original: ma skyes pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The unarisen is suchness.

original: de sten pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis sten par byed pa phyag rgya chen mo la bu mo zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de sten pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis sten par byed pa phyag rgya chen mo la bu mo zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The one who relies on that is the one who relies on it by means of its nature. The great seal should be called the girl.

original: de'i phyir rgyu las zhi ba zhes bya ba mngon par brjod par bya ste langs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu las zhi ba zhes bya ba mngon par brjod par bya ste langs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the expression “arisen from the cause” is the one who has arisen.

original: rten 'brel zhes bya ba la sogs pas ldang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rten 'brel zhes bya ba la sogs pas ldang bar byed pa'o //
translated: One should rise by means of the so-called dependent origination.

original: bag chags zhes pa sngon gyi 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags zhes pa sngon gyi 'phen pa'o //
translated: The latent impressions are the previous impulsion.

original: ye shes kha phye me tog go //
analyzed: ye shes kha phye me tog go //
translated: The flower is the opening of intuition.

original: zhes bya ba ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum po rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum po rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The three intuitions of appearance, etc., are made manifest.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: dngos po med pa rgyan zhes bya //
analyzed: dngos po med pa rgyan zhes bya //
translated: The ornament is called the non-existent.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: mnyes par bya ba ni rtag tu de la dmigs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mnyes par bya ba ni rtag tu de la dmigs par bya ba'o //
translated: One should always attend to it, i.e., the ornament.

original: 'di 'dra ni gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ni gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Such is the definition of the ornament.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the Dharma-element is the Dharma-element.

original: ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa de dag rab tu mi gnas pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa de dag rab tu mi gnas pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: The non-existence, etc., shows that they do not really exist.

original: phyag rgya chen po 'di m'a la ka'i zhes bya ba'i bdag nyid can gnyug ma'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po 'di m'a la ka'i zhes bya ba'i bdag nyid can gnyug ma'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This great seal is the nature of the Malaya-called self, i.e., the innate nature.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of that is the nature of intuition.

original: nam mkha' ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Space is suchness.

original: gnas pa ni de'i bdag nyid du'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni de'i bdag nyid du'o //
translated: Abiding is in the nature of that.

original: de bas ni yongs su dag pa'i ye shes kyi sku 'di la'o //
analyzed: de bas ni yongs su dag pa'i ye shes kyi sku 'di la'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the completely pure body of wisdom.

original: sdud pa'i phyir ni sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdud pa'i phyir ni sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of gathering, for the sake of union.

original: bshad pas ni yul du mngon par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pas ni yul du mngon par brjod par bya'o //
translated: By explanation, the object should be expressed.

original: gci ba'i bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gci ba'i bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach the explanation of urine, it is said:

original: gci bzhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: gci bzhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
translated: Urine and so forth.

original: ye shes dang dbang po lnga ni ye shes dbang po'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang dbang po lnga ni ye shes dbang po'o //
translated: The five wisdoms and faculties are the wisdom faculties.

original: bstan pa ni gsungs so //
analyzed: bstan pa ni gsungs so //
translated: The teaching is spoken.

original: khrag ni sems can gyi don du gang la chags pa'o zhes pa yul la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: khrag ni sems can gyi don du gang la chags pa'o zhes pa yul la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Blood is that which is attached for the sake of sentient beings, that is, to objects and so forth.

original: rgyu de'i phyir lha rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir lha rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: For that reason, they are called gods.

original: dngos po med pa ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: Non-entity is the very absence of intrinsic nature.

original: 'bul ba ni nye bar 'bul bar @79b byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bul ba ni nye bar 'bul bar @79b byed pa'o //
translated: Offering is making an offering.

original: 'jig rten pas ni 'jig rten la rab tu grags pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas ni 'jig rten la rab tu grags pas so //
translated: Mundane is well-known in the world.

original: brtags pa ni yul la sogs pa yongs su brtags pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa ni yul la sogs pa yongs su brtags pa'o //
translated: Imagination is the imagination of objects and so forth.

original: de rnams ni bskyed pa'i rim pa spyod pa rnams gang yin pa de rnams ji skad gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de rnams ni bskyed pa'i rim pa spyod pa rnams gang yin pa de rnams ji skad gsungs pa ni /
translated: Those are the conduct of the creation stage.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i bshad par ro //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i bshad par ro //
translated: Those are as they are taught in the commentary on the creation stage.

original: nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to //
translated: The definitive meaning.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod pa'i mchog tu gsal bar gyur pa'i ye shes kyi me spyad pa spyod byed do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod pa'i mchog tu gsal bar gyur pa'i ye shes kyi me spyad pa spyod byed do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The supreme expression by “realization,” etc., is the fire of the gnosis that is supremely clear.
